loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Zainab from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of one year and 11 years. Two of her children attend school. She started business to get her daily survival for her family.
 
Zainab runs a food stand business, she sells cooking seasoning, oil and rice within a busy market in her area. She has been running this business since 2011. She works at the business 12 hours per day and six days per week. Zainab says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Zainab has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities like cooking seasoning, oil and rice for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to have a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities like cooking seasoning, oil and rice for resale.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en: Liana is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and son in a small village in the Zestaponi district. Liana is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has two pigs and a vineyard. Liana's husband produces wine and sells it. Liana decided to start an additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan 1000 Gel to purchase a cow. As the cow is purchased, she will start producing cheese to sell. This will increase the income of her family and with increased income, she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Zaitoon

texts.en: Zaitoon is a 37-year-old, vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people in her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. She is hopeful to meet the orders of her customers on time, which will ultimately increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons for her sewing business.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 43 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell.

Jasmin has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia is a 24-year-old married woman. For about nine years she has been creating hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with the packs of beads, sequins, and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of her children's bright and prosperous future. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embroidery.

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en: Mehnaz is a 27-year-old vigorous married woman and a mother of three children. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past five years. Mehnaz’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs 15000, to buy raw materials such as spools of thread along with the packs of sequins and pearls in different colors to complete the orders of her customers on time.  She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as spools of thread along with packs of sequins and pearls in different colors for embroidery.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is married woman with no children. She owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She cites price fluctuation as her major challenge.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila is a 32-year-old married woman. She is been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to deal with more customers time-after-time. For this, she requires hair care products and skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 through Kashf Foundation. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move towards a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products and skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en: Tareq is a 22-year-old single young man from a small village near Jenin city. Tareq lives with his parents in a very humble house. His father is a worker with a very low wage that is not enough to cover all the family needs. So, Tareq decided to work to help his family with part of the expenses. For the past three years, Tareq has been working in distributing gas tanks for houses in the city and to villages nearby. Tareq took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more empty gas tanks for his business, This will increase his profit and also will improve the family's living conditions. Tareq appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more empty gas tanks for his retail business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama is 28 years old, married, and has three children. She is from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She began her business because she wants to empower herself.  In 2010, Adama established her local food stuff business.  She works from 8:00 AM until 9:00 PM, Monday to Friday. Her main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Adama is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase a gallon of palm oil and gari to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Adama plans to own the biggest local food store in the community.

loans.use: to purchase a gallon of palm oil and gari to sell

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 43-year-old married lady and mother of three. She runs a small general store in her community to meet her daily household expenses.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Yasmeen makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store, she is requesting a loan of Rs 40,000 which she will use to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 36 years old and married. She has been stitching clothes for eight years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family.

Due to lack of funds, Nasreen is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is requesting her fifth loan from Kashf Foundation for 15,000 PKR, which she will to use to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she can generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers, and buttons .

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children. 

For about 15 years, she has been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her earnings and dreams for her children's bright future. She has been in association with Kashf foundation for eight years and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics products for her store to resell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single woman with one child who is an adult. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rental bills.

For the past one year, she has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. Her potential customers are town dwellers. She cites high maintenance costs as her major challenge.

With the KES 80,000 she wants to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 21-year-old married woman. 

Rabia is successfully running an animals sales and purchase business. She buys baby goats from the market and then sells them when they grow up. She is very experienced in her business and has 25 goats at this time. Her husband also assists her by purchasing animals from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

Rabia wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy two more goats. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy two more goats.

loans.name: Memunatu       M

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Memunatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has eight children.  

In 2010, Memunatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to create a source of living. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m., Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and lack of finance to expand her business.

Memunatu requires a loan in order to purchase different types of clothing material to expand her clothing business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and buy a piece of land. In the future, Memunatu plans to own the biggest clothing shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase different types of clothing material to expand her clothing business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a single lady with no children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Emily has operated a clothes selling business for the past two years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 46 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Luz has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. 

Ma. Luz requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sugran

texts.en:
Sugran is a 48-year-old married lady and a mother of nine children. 

She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Due to lack of availability of funds, however, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 33-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Recently, she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her tenth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which lies in the tea-growing region of Kenya. He has no children and has been doing this work for seven years. His primary income sources are milk, tea and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Brings in more income through the output." His biggest challenge is that "farming is expensive." An animal on the farm has been given the name of "Poet."

Wesley was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "It has [a] grace period." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Funds [and] assets."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Wesley replied, "Increased income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Wesley owns the following: "cow, poultry, motorcycle," but does not own "pig, pump, bicycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity and a TV, but does not have solar power, running water, a sewing machine or DVD.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 46 years old, married, and has seven children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rowena has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Rowena requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional kitchen wares and ingredients for her food business. In the future, Rowena would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchen wares and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 46-year-old Aminata from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with five children between the ages of 10 years and 25 years. She began her business because she wanted to develop her family's standard of living. In 1991, Aminata established her local foodstuff business. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m., Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase gallons of palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to own the biggest local food store in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. For the past 10 years, Irshad has been running a business of carpet manufacturing. She makes it with the special kind of wood known as "dub wood." Theses carpets are used in mosques for the purpose of prayer. 

By this time, she has become popular in her community for providing good quality carpets. Her husband is a driver by profession, but his salary is not enough to meet home expenses, which are increasing day by day. This compelled Irshad to work to contribute to the family income. 

In order to purchase stock of wood and some utensils such as cutters and scissors, she applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation for the second time. It will help her to increase her production of carpets to inflate her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wood and some utensils such as cutters and scissors to make prayer mats.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 41-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.  She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees), which she will use to buy packs of grains, oil and biscuits from the wholesale market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of grains, oil and biscuits.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 49-year-old married father of four children. He works in construction and is specialized in concrete work. He is a hard worker with 33 years of experience. Walid is the family’s sole breadwinner; that’s why he has to work hard to expand his working sector to make sure that his expected income is enough to cover all the family needs. 

Walid is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to make necessary maintenance work and painting on his house before the winter season to keep it a healthy living medium. His dream is to start up a cattle farm.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance work and painting on his house before the winter season to keep it a healthy living medium.

loans.name: Reehana

texts.en:
Reehana is 34 years old, married, and has four children. Sixteen years ago, she decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Due to lack of  funds, Reehana is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is requesting her second loan for 30,000 PKR, which she will be to purchase more spools of threads along with the packs of ribbons and laces in different colors.  This loan will help her to cater to more customers.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads along with the packs of ribbons and laces in different colors.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a single woman with no children.  She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a motorcycle business. She faces major challenges of motorcycle breakdown and muddy roads during the rainy season. She dreams of buying a new motorcycle and developing herself.

With the loan of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase spare parts and repaint her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to obtain loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and repaint her motorcycle

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario, es madre soltera; su niño tiene 2 años de edad, viven en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona 16 de Julio  de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundario, tiene un taller de costura ubicado en el mismo domicilio, elabora edredones para cuna para bebé, las mismas las comercializa al por mayor los días domingos en la feria de la misma zona.
El crédito lo requiere para adquirir materia prima como ser telas al por mayor en diferentes texturas, colores, y diseños así podrá variar sus productos.
El sueño de  Rosario es llegar a tener un taller más grande y producir mayor volumen.
Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Rosario is a single mother of a 2-year old boy. They live in her parents' house, located in the neighborhood 16 de Julio, in the city of El Alto. She attended secondary school and now has a sewing studio at home where she makes crib quilts. She sells her products to wholesalers at the fair that takes place every Sunday in the neighborhood. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric in bulk in different textures, colors and designs, so that she can offer a wider variety of products. Her dream is to have a bigger studio and to produce a higher volume. This is the first time she requests a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric in bulk in different textures and colors for her dressmaking business of crib quilts.

loans.name: Marco Aurelio

texts.es: Marco es un hombre de 43 años de edad, casado y padre de dos hijos de 6 y 9 años. Hijo de padres campesinos que le enseñaron desde pequeño las labores agrícolas, gracias a ello, actualmente se desempeña como mayordomo de una finca en una región del oriente antioqueño, allí tiene cultivos de fríjol sembrados en un lote de tierra que su jefe le presta y, cuando recolecta la cosecha la vende en la plaza de mercado del pueblo, de esta manera complementa sus ingresos con los cuales solventa las necesidades básicas de su hogar. El cliente se caracteriza por ser pujante, activo y trabajador, se esmera por salir siempre adelante. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas (insecticidas, fungicidas y abonos) para continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y sacar una cosecha más productiva que le genere mejores ingresos. De esta manera Marco podrá seguir avanzando, pues desea adquirir una parcela para tener sus cultivos y trabajar de manera independiente, con lo que espera tener la oportunidad de brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y que sus hijos puedan tener una excelente educación.
texts.en:
Marco is a 43-year-old man, married and has two children aged 6 and 9. His parents were farmers and taught him to work in agriculture when he was a kid. Thanks to this, he works today as an administrator for a farm in Eastern Antioquia [Antioquia is a department of Colombia]. He grows beans in a piece of land that the owner lent him and then sells the harvest at the marketplace in town. This is how he receives an additional income to cover the home expenses.

Marco is a persistent, energetic and hardworking person who fights to get ahead. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies (insecticides, fungicides and fertilizers) to give maintenance to his plantations and have a more productive harvest in order to improve his income. This way, Marco will continue progressing. He wants to buy a piece of land where he can have his plantations and work in an independent manner. This, he hopes, will give him the opportunity to offer his family a better quality of life and give his children an excellent education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as insecticides, fungicides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 48-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has one cow, which she uses for milk, selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit.  

Sajida has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she is in her second loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. 

Sajida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her two children.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
Tenneh is 35 years old and married, with four children between the ages of 3 years and 13 years. She runs a bakery business in Waterloo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She has three additional dependents at home.

She's been in this business since 2012 and sells cakes within her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is lack of capital to expand.

Tenneh requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more flour, sugar, and oil to expand her baked goods. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and change her status of living. 

In the future, she would like to build her own bakery. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, and oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Ericka

texts.es:
Ericka está separada y tiene un hijo el cual aún no asiste al colegio, viven en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Los Andes  de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundario, tiene un taller de costura donde realiza chalecos para varón.
El crédito lo requiere para adquirir tela de distintos diseños y fibra al por mayor ya que el precio tiende a bajar. Así podrá ofrecer a sus clientes chalecos para damas, niños y una variedad de modelos en prendas, ya que ahora diversificará sus productos.
El sueño de  Ericka es convertirse es una distribuidora al por mayor.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Ericka is separated and has a son who is not attending school. They live in her parents' house, located in Los Andes, in the city of El Alto. She attended secondary school and now has a sewing studio where she makes vests for men. 

She is requesting a loan to buy synthetic and fabric in different designs. She will buy in bulk so that the prices would go down and she will be able to offer her vests to women and children too as well as a wider variety of designs. Her dream is to become a wholesaler. 

This is the second time she requests a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric in different designs to make vests.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes.  She is 53 and a resident of Payatas, Philippines. Lourdes is married to Romy, a laborer, and she has four children who work already. Lourdes, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. Lourdes works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Lourdes operates a piggery. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes she has the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market.  Aside from this, Lourdes also cooks breakfast meals for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,200 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, Lourdes is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. Lourdes hopes that her piggery will continue to grow and that she can have her pigpen renovated. She dreams that her children will have a good education. 

Lourdes meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Chepngeno

texts.en:
Chepngeno lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which lies in the tea growing region of Kenya. She has no children and has been doing farming work for three years. Her primary income sources are milk, tea, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Dairy keeping." Her biggest challenge is: "Drought." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Geot."

Chepngeno was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Improvement of livelihood."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "It offers cheap interest."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked: "How will this loan benefit her family?," Chepngeno replied: "Increased income."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Chepngeno owns the following: 'cow and poultry,' but she does not own: 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile.'

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net, electricity, and TV,' but she does not have: 'solar power, running water, sewing machine or DVD.'

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es:
Benedicto, es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en alquiler en una casa que se encuentra ubicada en la zona Cosmos 79 de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario. El trabaja de ayudante de cerrajero  y gana un jornal diario.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar herramientas de trabajo para así poder independizarse y tener mejores ingresos y calidad de vida
El sueño de Benedicto es tener su propio taller de cerrajería dar trabajo a varias personas.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Benedicto is single, with no children.  He lives in a rental house located in the Cosmos 79 area of the city of El Alto. He studied through the middle school level.  He works as a locksmith’s assistant and earns a daily wage.

He needs the loan to buy work tools so that he can become independent and have a better income and quality of life.  Benedicto’s dream is to have his own locksmith workshop to give work to various people.

This is the first time that he has asked for a loan from IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tools for his work as a locksmith, to be able to become an independent worker.

loans.name: Eviline

texts.en:
Eviline is the mother of four children, who go to school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves, and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves, and wheat flour for resale

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma, es madre soltera tiene un hijo y vive en alquiler en la zona de Alto San pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz

Actualmente trabaja como líder en Yambal (es una línea de cosméticos); tiene varias promotoras a sus cargo a las cuales entrena para que vendan los productos y de esta manera a ella le pagan una comisión..

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de productos los cuales los adquiere en campañas donde el precio es menor y los vende a sus promotoras y a las personas en general y de esta manera genera más ingresos

Es la quinta vez junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Irma is a single mother. She has a son and rents a place in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz. She is currently working as a “leader” for Yanbal, which is a company that produces cosmetics. She is in charge of some saleswomen; she trains them to sell the different products and they pay her a commission.

Irma is requesting a loan to buy products that are on sale and thus are cheaper. She sells them to the saleswomen and also to regular customers. This way, she will increase her income. This is her fifth time working with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy Yanbal products [cosmetics] that are on sale and sell them.

loans.name: Subih

texts.en:
Subih is a 20-year-old, single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city. Subhi finished high school with a very good score and he now studies in the university as a media designer. He is in his second year. He loves this specialization.

Subih took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him to do his homework and reports, using specific programs. This loan will ensure that he finishes his studies in the university with very good grades and that he finds a good job in the future. Subhi appears in the photo with his laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Sailigul

texts.ru: Сайлигул заботливая мать 3 не совершеннолетних детей. Она замужем. Ее муж имеет маленький доход и поэтому ей приходится трудиться упорно, для того, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. Она родилась в 1970 года на юге Таджикистана и выросла здесь. Она с детства помогала родителям по домохозяйству и поэтому с детства она была привязана к упорному труду. Более 12 лет она занимается собственным бизнесом. Она занимается купле продажей фруктов. Она оптом покупает фрукты из других районов и реализует в розницу на местном рынке. Она имеет свою торговую точку и старается предоставить местным жителям фрукты высшего сорта. Она с бизнесом справляется сама. Она сталкивается многими трудностями введение бизнеса и мечтает, чтобы дети выросли и начали помогать ей. Она намерена расширить свой ассортимент товара и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 12000 сомони для покупки фруктов. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Sailigul is a caring mother of three adolescent children.  She is married.  Her husband has a low income and this is why she has to work hard to earn a living.  She was born in 1970 in the south of Tajikistan and grew up there.  Since childhood, she had helped her parents with the household and has gotten used to hard work since then.  She has been involved in her own business for over 12 years.  She is involved in buying and selling fruits.  She buys fruits wholesale from other districts and sells them retail at a local market.  She has her own retail outlet and tries to offer the highest quality fruits to the local residents.  She handles the business by herself.  She faces many difficulties in running the business and dreams that her children grew up and started helping her.  Sailigul intends to expand the selection of her products and is requesting a loan in the amount of 12000 somoni to buy fruits.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fruits and expand her product selection

loans.name: Mukadaspocho

texts.ru: Мукадаспочо родилась в 1976 года. Она живет вместе своей дочерью на юге Таджикистана. Мукадаспочо разведенная женщина, и является единственной кормилицей семьи. Она более 14 лет работает в больнице в должности уборщицы. Она использует полученную зарплату для обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Она серьёзно больна и не имеет денег, чтобы лечится. Так как она разведена и не имеет кормильца, ей не на кого надеется. Мукадаспочо запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения и восстановления здоровья. Она ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ей улучшить здоровья.
texts.en: Mukadaspocho was born in 1976.  She lives with her daughter in the south of Tajikistan.  Mukadaspocho is a divorced woman and the sole provider for the family.  She has been working as a janitor at a hospital for over 14 years.  She uses her salary to provide the family with all of the necessities.  She is seriously ill and does not have money for a treatment.  Because she is divorced, she does not have a provider and anyone to rely on.  Mukadaspocho is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to purchase medicine for treatment and restoration of her health.  She awaits her kindness.  This loan will help her to improve her health.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for treatment and restoration of her health

loans.name: Tujumbere Group

texts.fr:
Donatien fait parti du groupe Tujimbere et habite à Gitega. Il a 36 ans et est marié à Pascasie, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 3 à 5 ans.

Il fait le commerce de bananes et le transport par vélo.

Il est à son neuvième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup de bananes à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait acheter du bétail et des parcelles.
texts.en:
Donatien is a member of the Tujimbere group and lives in Gitega. He is 36 years old and is married to Pascasie, a merchant. Together they have five children aged three to five years old.

Donatien is a banana merchant, and transports his wares by bicycle. He is on his ninth loan with Turame. With the loan he receives from Kiva, he plans to increase his capital by purchasing a large number of bananas that he will sell to earn more income. In the coming years, he would like to buy cattle and land parcels.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of bananas that he will sell to earn more income.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.es:
Jeanette, esta casada tiene dos hijos, vive en casa alquilada en la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de la Paz.

Actualmente tiene un automóvil con el cual trabaja su esposo y genera sus ingresos, pero además por las noches vende hamburguesas y ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de otro par de  llantas para su vehículo ya que es su principal herramienta de trabajo con la cual genera sus ingresos y puede mantener a su familia.

Es la septima vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jeanette is married and has two children. She lives in a rented house in the San Martín neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

At present, she has an automobile that her husband works with to generate income. She also sells hamburgers at night and helps her husband with the household expenses.

The loan she is requesting is to purchase another pair of tires for her vehicle, since it is the main work tool she has with which to generate an income and be able to support her family.

It is her seventh time working with IMPRO and the third time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy an engine and tires for her vehicle.

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Luz Divina está conformado por ocho integrantes. Madres y padres responsables con 1 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracterizan por ser personas responsables con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la obligación de trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos de hogar.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Vilma tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa, como pantalones, camisas, faldas, short, ropa de cama, vestidos, ropa interior, toallas, piyamas, talladores. Actividad que la  desempeña de forma ambulante, por encargo a clientes fijos y eventuales. Ella dedica a su actividad unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su mercadería. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Luz Divina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas  de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua, para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Luz Divina" communal bank is made up of eight members, who are responsible mothers and fathers with one child under their care. They live in Sauce, which is located in the western part of the country. They are all responsible people who want to improve themselves. In their free time, they enjoy spending time with their children. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, they were not able to study and they found themselves obligated to work from a young age in order to help support their households.

Thanks to her hard work and her desire to move forward, Vilma is the coordinator of the group. To make a living, she sells clothing like pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, bedding, dresses, underwear, towels, and pajamas. She performs her work on foot, traveling to her permanent and prospective clients. She dedicates about 10 hours per day to selling her merchandise. This loan will be used to invest in working capital and to stock her business, so that in the near future she will be able to earn more income.

The "Luz Divina" communal bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people with few resources and poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have respectable work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business with merchandise like pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, bedding, dresses, underwear, towels, and pajamas.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which has a climate that is excellent for agriculture. He has one child and has been in his current line of work for five years. Most of his income comes from producing milk, tea and various crops. He enjoys farming but also knows that it is expensive to maintain a farm. He is requesting this loan from Juhudi Kilimo to increase his income, He joined our organization as a way to improve his productivity. His highest monthly expense is farming costs.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Robert owns the following: a cow, poultry and a motorcycle, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in his household a mosquito net, electricity and a TV but does not have solar power, running water, a sewing machine or a DVD.

loans.use: to increase his output of milk.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase more stationary items, such as pens and books for her business .

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date, has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more stationary items, such as pens and books for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 22 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq with his family, which consists of six siblings and his parents. One of his brothers is in the military. He works selling clothes and at the same time is in his 4th year studying for a bachelor's of microfinance. He is planning to continue his studies until he gets his master's degree. Mohammad is currently facing some difficulties in paying for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Goderdzi

texts.en:
Goderdzi is a 67-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, daughter and aunt. His aunt is provided with a retirement pension. Goderdzi is involved in agricultural activities. He has two cows and a vineyard. His wife milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell. Goderdzi produces wine and sells to local retailers at a good price. 

He decided to start a new business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,000 GEL and start trade with clothing. He will purchase clothes form the wholesalers and then sell them among his villagers. This will increase his income.

loans.use: to begin trade with clothing.

loans.name: Nasima

texts.en: Nasima was born in 1972. She is married and a mother of four children. Her husband is a driver. Nasima has been selling blankets and clothes for 1 year. She started her project by selling them to her neighbors and friends. Now she is planning to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of blankets and clothes in order to raise her sales and income to provide good financial support for her family. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of blankets to trade

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas is a 62-year-old married father of three children. Since 1995, he has worked in distributing water for daily and agricultural use to villagers since lack of water is a major problem in Lebanon.

Nicolas is a hard worker and he puts much effort to reply directly to customer requests.
 
He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy bigger water storage tanks in order to store water to increase his water capital and respond to increasing customers’ requests.

Nicolas is planning to buy a new agricultural tractor that he will use to expand his working sector in agriculture as an additional income business.

loans.use: to buy bigger water storage tanks to store water to increase his water capital and respond to increasing customers’ requests.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia, esta separada del esposo tiene tres hijos vive con su señora madre que es mayor de edad  en la zona de Lllojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente trabaja como profesora Parbularia percibiendo un sueldo pequeño con el cual mantiene a su familia, tambien percibe una asistencia familiar para sus hijos.

El crédito lo requiere para pagar los gastos medicos de su señora madre quien se encuentra mal de salud y ella como es hija mayor debe hacerse cargo.

Es la cuarta vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Claudia is separated and has three children. They live with her mother, who is an elder person, in the neighborhood of Lllojeta, in the city of La Paz. She works as a preschool teacher and receives a low salary to support her family. She also receives some family assistance for her children. 

She is requesting a loan to pay for her mother's medical expenses. She needs to take care of her as she is the oldest daughter. 

This is the forth time she works with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her dependent mother's medical expenses.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is 25 years old; he lives with his wife and his 2 children in Gaza. He has a store for selling school products. He earns a monthly income $650. He started his business on the first of November, 2012.

Mohamad needs this youth loan to repair a printer machine and buy new school products, especially since it’s the school season now.

Mohamad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: repair a printer and buy school supplies to sell

loans.name: Hassan's Group

texts.en:
Hassan is a member of this group from Iraq. Hassan is 30 years old; he is married and has three children. 

He has been working in the agriculture sector for 13 years. He is a hard worker who is specialized in growing palm trees and selling dates. Hassan takes good care of his production and makes sure that every tree has the care it needs to ensure high quality production.

Hassan will use this loan to purchase fertilizers, a water pump and upgrade his irrigation system to reduce water waste and control the growth of harmful weeds. 

Hassan expects that the loan will generate additional income that will enable him to fence his farm.

The story of Hassan and his farm is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers, a water pump and upgrade his irrigation system.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: est une femme de 54 ans mariée mère de 6 enfants dont l'age varie entre 24 ans et 36 ans. Elle a ouvert un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis des années. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour lui. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (alvéoles d'oeufs,huile, 1 sac de riz, palette de poisson, viandes, les crudités et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Elle réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
The client is a 54 year old married woman, and the mother of six children between the ages of 24 and 36 years old. She opened and has been managing her own restaurant for years. It is thanks to this business that she is able to care for her family.

The fact that she has to purchase her restaurant supplies at retail prices means that she cannot earn much income on her end product. Hence the importance of this loan for her business, as it will allow her to increase her stock of ingredients (cartons of eggs, oil, a sack of rice, a pallet of fish, meat, vegetables and the seasonings needed to cook her dishes). She plans to reinvest a part of her income into her business, and the rest will help her provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Saffie

texts.en:
Saffie is 45 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is married and has five children between the ages of 13 and 21 years old who are in school and live at home. 

For the past seven years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market; spending eight hours on her business each day, from Monday to Saturday. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this way of selling from her mother. 

Saffie is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Saffie hopes to improve her children education even more and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Crisandra

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Crisandra works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Crisandra is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to purchase spare parts for her tricycle.

Crisandra has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Azhar Group

texts.en:
This group is called Azhar, and consists of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They took out a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB. 

Safa is 23 years old. She has been selling basic products like clothes, perfumes, incense, among other things. She has had the business for few years and has many customers who come to her because it is the best-stocked place in the neighborhood. 

She needs to buy materials for her business but has no capital, so she is requesting a loan from AMB to allow her to buy clothes, perfumes, and incense among other things. 

She hopes to expand her business to get more profit.

loans.use: to allow her to buy clothes, perfumes and incense, among other things.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Ciudadela Ferroviaria en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de seis horas en la preparación y atención del servicio de comida en una empresa privada .
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos de cocina(mas vajilla, ollas, sartenes, etc.) para dar mejor atención en el servicio que presta ya que desea atender mayor cantidad de comensales y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos, porque con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, transporte y pago de servicios básicos.
El sueño de Jaime es tener su propio restaurante ya que  es chef y también atender eventos para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Jaime is single and does not have children. He lives at his parents' house, located in the neighborhood of Ciudadela Ferroviaria, in the city of La Paz, and uses only one bedroom. He currently works for over six hours preparing food for a private company and providing customer service. 

He is requesting a loan to buy kitchen supplies (dinner service, pans, pots, etc.) so that he can provide a better service and reach a higher number of customers. This would allow him to increase his income and to cover his expenses in food, transportation and basic services. Jaime's dream is to have his own restaurant as chef and to serve at events so that he can improve his income and quality of life. 

This is the first time he requests a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy dinner service, pots, pans, etc. to provide a better service at the restaurant where he works serving customers.

loans.name: Leontine

texts.en:
Leontine is 36 years old. She owns a bar and has been running the bar for two years. 

She would like to buy more beer and soda for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children. She has moved from selling retail to owning a bar which she hopes will make more returns.

loans.use: To buy more beers and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 26-year-old married mother of three children. She has been working as a farmer since seven years ago, specializing in planting eggplants and bell peppers. Rana supports her husband in covering their family’s expenses. 

Today, she is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy the necessary seeds and fertilizers for her land, and will use part of the loan to buy firewood for the coming winter season to keep her beloved children warm. 

Rana loves her small business, and she hopes to stay healthy and capable of expanding and developing it to produce more products in the future.

loans.use: to buy the necessary seeds and fertilizers for her land and firewood for the coming winter season to keep her children warm.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Helen is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF  to purchase more frozen food to sell.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en: Rezo is a 48-year-old married man. He lives in a small village in the Sachkhere district with his wife and two children. His children go to school. Rezo is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has two cows. His wife milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell. In addition, he has 1.25 hectares of land, where he grows maize and haricot. Rezo decided to start a new business and requested a loan. The start up loan, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to borrow 2500 Gel for purchasing two buffaloes. He will use them to transport wood from the forest to sell.

loans.use: to purchase buffaloes

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Jariatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 12 years. Two of her children attend school. She started a business to get her daily survival for her family.
 
Jariatu runs a cookery business; she sells cookery at her house. She has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business from 4:30; she will not rest until the food finishes. Jariatu says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Jariatu has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities, such as cooking season, oil and rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. 

In the future, she plans to have a big cookery shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities, such as cooking seasonings, oil and rice.

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: Monique est une femme de 39 ans, mariée, mère de famille. Elle a un atelier de couture qu'elle gère depuis 13 ans déjà dans un quartier de la capitale. Elle a une bonne clientèle mais se retrouve tout le temps en rupture de matériel parce qu'elle achète en petite quantité pour confectionner les vêtements qu'elle vend. Ce crédit lui permettra d'acheter en grande quantité son matériel de couture(accessoires, tissus) ce qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs, satisfaire sa clientèle et réaliser un bon profit. Ce bénéfice lui permettra non seulement de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille, mais aussi d'agrandir son activité avec le temps en achetant en grande quantité.
texts.en:
Monique is a 39-year-old woman, married, and the mother of a family. She has a tailoring shop which she has run for 13 years in a neighborhood of the capital. She has a good customer base but keeps running out of material because she has to buy it in small quantities to create the clothing she sells. 

This loan will allow Monique to purchase her material (accessories, fabric) in bulk which will allow her to achieve her business goals, meet the needs of her customers, and earn a decent profit. This loan will allow her not only to provide for the daily needs of her family and herself, but also to grow her business over time by purchasing in larger quantities.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel, es soltero y tiene una hija que esta en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación que tiene paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra,la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como comerciante ambulante en la venta de celulares,visita todas las ferias para poder tener mas venta y mejorar sus ingresos ya que con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación,educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mas celulares ya que debe actualizar su stock ya que la gente le pide otros mucho mas actuales.
El sueño de Miguel es tener su propia tienda para la venta de celulares y mejorar sus ingresos para poder brindarle mejor calidad de vida a su hija y también brindarle comodidad.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Miguel is single and has a daughter who is in school. Their live in their own home, occupying only one room which has brick walls and dirt floors. The house is located in the Obispo Bosque area of the city of La Paz. Miguel works as an itinerant seller of mobile phones. He visits all the markets of the city to sell more and increase his income. With the little that he makes he has to pay for food, education and the household expenses of his family.

Miguel needs the loan to buy more cellular phones as he needs to update his stock as people are looking for more up to date models. Miguel's dream is to have his own shop to sell phones and increase his income. Then he can provide a higher quality of living to his daughter and offer her more comfort. This is the first time he has requested a joint IMPRO KIVA loan.

loans.use: to buy cell phones to sell to his clients.

loans.name: Ryskan

texts.ru: Рыскан 51 год, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает пятерых детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Рыскан - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Рыскан занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 80,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Рыскан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 50 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рыскан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Рыскан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Ryskan is 51 years old, a widow and raising five children alone after her husband's death, and is also running her own business. Ryskan has a higher education. To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 23 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 80,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Ryskan's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 1 horse and 50 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 13,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Ryskan requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a horse in order to increase livestock headcount. Ryskan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her children's continued education.

loans.use: to buy a horse in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which is tea growing region. She has seven children and has been in her current line of work for three years. Her primary income sources are producing milk, tea and various crops. She loves farming, even though she knows that calamities can affect crops and livestock. She is requesting this loan to improve her farm and increase her income. Her biggest monthly expense is the cost of running her farm.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Ruth owns the following: a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in her household a mosquito net, TV, and DVD but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, or a sewing machine.

loans.use: to begin raising poultry.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which has a very beautiful countryside, ie. very smart. She has two children and has been doing this work for three years. Her primary income sources are milk, tea, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Farming!' Her biggest challenge is 'Expensive.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Tema.'

Lilian was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'It funds assets.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'It promotes low income earners.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Lilian replied 'Improvement income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Lilian owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, TV' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (fabric, thread, elastic, and patterns) and to perform maintenance on her machines.

loans.name: Smbat

texts.en:
Smbat is from Vanadzor town, and is the father of two students, his daughters. He works at a local factory as a production manager, and his wife takes care of their household. 

Smbat's daughters study at the Yerevan State Medical University after Mkhitar Heratsi. Smbat's salary to covers his household costs, but it is not enough to save for his daughters' education costs. So, this hardworking and beloved father asks for help from lenders to cover his elder daughter's tuition fee. 

He will be very grateful for such a great assistance.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for his daughter.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth lives in the Kericho area, which lies in the tea-growing region of Kenya. She has two children and has been doing this work for five years. Her primary income sources are milk, tea and crops.

She stated that dairy farming is what is most enjoyable about farming. Her biggest challenge is lack of enough capital. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Lelgong.' Janeth is borrowing 40000 KES to construct a greenhouse.

Janeth was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Improves low-income earners.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Loan repayment is done monthly.'

Her highest monthly expense is the cost of farming. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Janeth replied 'Increased income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Janeth owns the following: 'cow, poultry, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.'

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old Sarah from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with six children, two in school. She started her food stand business to support her family.
 
Sarah sells cooking oil, seasonings and rice at her house. She has been running this business since 1990. She works at the business 12 hours per day and six days per week.  Sarah says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Sarah has requested a loan to buy food commodities like cooking oil, seasonings and rice for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and buy a freezer to improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to have a big provision shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities like cooking oil, seasonings and rice for resale.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créer ce 18 septembre 2013 à l’occasion de son inauguration dans la place publique du village, ce banc villageois compte en son sein des femmes déterminées à entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenu et de renforcer leur capacité de financement. Elles vivent dans un même village depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce.
 
Madame Fatou, âgée de 46 ans (assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère 02 filles et un garçon. Elle est prévoit de s’investir dans la vente de légumes frais qu’elle achètera auprès des producteurs des villages pour la revente dans les marchés hebdomadaires et au marché communal. Elle compte renouveler son stock tous les 15 jours.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle désire acheter un sac d’ognons à 15 000 F CFA, du sucre pour 20 000 F CFA, un carton de thé vert à 7 500 F CFA et 5 litre d’huile de palme.

Les bénéfices lui serviront à épargner et d’aider son mari dans les charges de la maison en prenant en partie les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Created on September 18, 2013, during the inauguration of the public square of the village, this Banc Villageois is made up of women who are determined to undertake income-generating activities and strengthen their financial standing. They have been living in the same village for several decades and maintain relations of solidarity and mutual aid. They run small businesses as merchants.
 
Fatou, aged 46 (shown in the photo sitting second from the right), is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and is the mother of two girls and one boy. She is planning to invest her loan into her business selling fresh vegetables that she will buy from the producers in the local villages. She will then sell her wares at the weekly markets and at the community market. She intends to renew her stock every 15 days .

With her new loan, she wants to buy a bag of onions for 15,000 Francs CFA, sugar for 20,000 Francs CFA, a carton of green tea for 7,500 Francs CFA, and 5 liters of palm oil. She will use the income she earns to contribute to her savings, and to help her husband with the household expenses by paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bag of onions for 15,000 Francs CFA, sugar for 20,000 Francs CFA, a carton of green tea for 7,500 Francs CFA, and 5 liters of palm oil.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, tiene la necesidad de una nueva inversión en su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, para poder  comprara tomates, güisquiles, papas, lechugas aguacates, manzanas, uvas, y peras, con las cuales cubrirá las necesidades de sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior ella aumento la variedad de productos que ofrecía en su negocio; generándole los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su economía y mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia. Su sueño es seguir ampliando su negocio y mantener la estabilidad que hasta hoy tiene.
texts.en: Blanca needs a new inversion of capital for her business selling vegetables and fruits. She needs to buy tomatoes, chayote, potatoes, lettuce, avocados, apples, grapes and pears to meets the demands of her customers. With her last loan she increased the variety of products she offers in her business, generating the income necessary to improve her finances and improve the living conditions of her family. Her dream is to continue to increase the size of her business and maintain the stability she has enjoyed up to now.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chayote, potatoes, lettuce and avocados.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 32 years old and lives in Caldwell with her husband and two children who are in school and are 2 and 15 years old. Over the past ten years, she has been selling dishes (plates, spoons, pans, etc.) in the local market, and spending 9 hours on her business each day, from Monday to Saturday.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more dishes for her business; she hopes to build a new home for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more dishes for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Hawa from Kandeh town Bo. She is married with six children. Four of her children are currently attending school. She began this business because she wanted to be self dependent.

Hawa runs a general stock business; she sells soft drinks, bread, biscuits and sweets. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day. Hawa says that sometime business is very difficult.

Hawa has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits and sweets for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children school fees and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than even. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits and sweet for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 45 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom attend school. She is from Kandeh town Bo. She runs a grocery store, which she has been doing for 20 years.  She sells soft drinks, bread, biscuits, and sweets. Emma works 10 hours a day, seven days a week. She began this business because she wanted to take very good care of her family.

Emma is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits, and sweets to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits, and sweets

loans.name: Flutura

texts.en: Flutura installed new windows in her house thanks to you. The loan that she is requesting now is to be used for stocking up on second-hand inventory items to resell. This is her activity where she generates the income for her family. Kindly note that we could not take a picture of her at her activity because at the moment she had none.

loans.use: to stock up on second-hand inventory items to resell

loans.name: Fatima Petrona

texts.es:
La Señora Fátima  de cincuenta y seis anos,  es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos  no  curso  estudios básicos, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante  Fátima  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es  una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como: huevos, arroz, azúcar, leche, pan, frijoles  detergentes, jabón, aceite, verduras, tiste, jugos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Fátima  agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Fatima, age 56, is from León, which is in the western part of the country. Fatima is known for being hard-working and responsible with a desire for self-improvement. In her free time she likes to enjoy spending time with her children.  Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources, she did not go to school.  She was obliged to work at an early age in order to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, Fatima has a business activity, which is a store located in her home. It is a small store where she sells food products in small quantities. She sells things like eggs, rice, sugar, milk, bread, beans, detergent, soap, cooking oil, vegetables, herbal tea, and juice.  She works some ten hours a day selling her products.  She does this in order to be able to get better income in the not so distant future.

Fatima is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have have ways of earning a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
María, solicita capital de trabajo para fortalecer más su negocio en el cual ofrece diversos productos, con el comprara blusas, faldas, camisetas, pantalones, jugos y sodas así de esta forma brindar mejores opciones de compra a sus clientes.
Anteriormente solicito un crédito que le género muchas ganancias y un número de clientes mayor del que poseía. Las condiciones de su núcleo familiar han cambiado notoriamente brindando así una mejor vida para los nuevos miembros de su familia.
texts.en:
María is requesting working capital to strengthen her business more.  In her business she offers diverse products.  She will use the loan to buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts, pants, juice, and soda.  This way she will provide better buying options for her customers.

She previously requested a loan that generated a lot of income for her and a greater number of customers than what she had.  Her family conditions have significantly changed, providing a better life for the new members of her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts, pants, juice, and soda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of drugs like anti-malarial and anti-bacterial drugs.

loans.name: Aymn

texts.en:
Aymn is a 26-year-old, single man living in a poor area in Taiz, Yemen. He is a hardworking and kindly man who strives to provide for his family. He is a driver earning a low salary, which is not enough to cover his family's expenses. 

He suffers a financial challenge because he doesn't have a second source of income besides his salary. Islamic Aid will be coming soon. So, he applied for a loan of 50,000 Yemeni Rials from AMB to buy a fridge to keep meat and food. He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy fridge to keep meat and food .

loans.name: Favio Jose

texts.es:
Favio de cuarenta y ocho años de edad, casado con tres hijos menores de edad, es originario de León, lugar que  está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser  responsables, trabajador, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de actividad con su familia. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, por falta de recursos económicos y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos de hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  el servicio de taxi, el cual brinda a  su comunidad, de forma rutiada, y servicios privados. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus servicios de taxi. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra de un juego de llantas nuevas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
