Her adult son is a day laborer and her husband is employed at a private business.  Through effort and dedication, she has been able to improve her home.  Her only dream is to see her house completely built and repaired.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy iron doors and to pay for the labor to have them installed.  She promises to repay this debt with the help of her son and husband.

loans.use: to buy metal doors and to pay for the labor to have them installed.

loans.name: Jose Rudis

texts.es:
José, tiene 46 años de edad, está casado, su esposa tiene 38 años de edad, tiene tres hijos menores de edad, que estudian en el colegio. José está dedicado al transporte de pasajeros, posee un microbús autorizado para transporte, él tiene tres años en este oficio y lo realiza de lunes a viernes.
José solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos como llantas nuevas y tambien le dará mantenimiento a la unidad de transporte. Considera que el préstamo ser muy útil porque mejorara las condiciones del microbús, dándole más vida útil y ofreciendo un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Su aspiración es mejorar la atención a los clientes y obtener mejores beneficios tambien para su familia.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and married.  His wife is 38 years old.  They have three young children who are in school.  

José transports passengers and owns a microbus that is an authorized vehicle.  He has been in this business for three years and works Monday through Friday.  José is requesting a loan so that he can buy parts, such as new tires.  He will also pay for the maintenance of his transport vehicle.  José believes this loan will be useful because the condition of his microbus will improve.  In addition, he will be more useful in life and be able to provide better service to his customers.  

His aspiration is to improve customer service and provide better benefits to his family as well.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his microbus and to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Esteban Rosa

texts.es:
Don Esteba es una persona muy trabajadora  y honesta vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y sus hijos. Su negocio es la compra y  venta de camarones, los cuales vende desde su casa de habitación.
Don estaban necesita el préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: camarones que necesita para cubrir la demanda que tiene. Espera  que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a esto contara con más producto para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Don estaban desea aumentar su negocio a tal grado que sea el más grande y conocido de la comunidad y  con esto seguir apoyando a sus hijos  para que terminen sus estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Don Esteban is a hardworking and honest person.  He lives in a community in southern Honduras along with his wife and children.  His business involves buying and selling shrimp, which he does out of his house.  

Don Esteban needs this loan so that he can buy more inventory since he lacks enough shrimp to meet existing demand.  He expects this loan will be of great help since he will have more product to satisfy the needs of his customers.  

Don Esteban wants to increase his business to the point that it becomes the largest and most well-known in his community.  This will enable him to continue supporting his children so that they can finish their studies and have better opportunities in life.  

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy more shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Mayble

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Mayble from Liberia. She lives in the Caldwell area of Liberia; this area is coming to be one of the most populated communities in Montserrado due to some options such as good roads, quietness, and the lower price of house rentals. Mayble is married to a contractor, and they have 2 children, ages 1 and 3, who live at home with them. Mayble herself did not attend school.

Over the past ten years, she has been selling lappa (traditional clothing).  She established the business with small loans from friends and says that she encounters few problems in her business other than finding good supplies at reasonable costs.  Her best trading comes at traditional holidays and Christmas. She is requesting a loan to expand the range of items she sells.  In the future, she wants to support her children and buy some land.

loans.use: to expand the range of items she sells.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 24 years old and married. For the last two years he has been running a food cafe that has been doing great. He is planning to buy a television screen and to renovate the cafe. He is also employed as a teacher, and he has a family member running the business for him. He hopes that in the next five years he will have a stable business. The major challenges for his business have been price changes and finding customers due to the stiff competition. He knew Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to take the programs. The extra income that he will raise will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a television screen and to renovate the cafe.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
This is Helena from Liberia. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the more populated communities in Montserrado due to some options such as good roads, quietness, and the lower price of house rental. 

Helena is 33 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 7 and 13, who live at home and attend school. Her husband is a builder. She has been running a table where she sells cosmetics. She is asking for a loan to buy enough cosmetics to increase her sales. She complains that the price of cosmetics is the major problem she faces now.  

She started this business with a little money from her husband. She enjoys her business because she makes her own money, and she is so proud of her business because it makes her independent. Her plans are to one day own a house, and to see her children attending university in the future. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy enough cosmetics to increase her sales.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 56-year-old married man and the father of 3 sons and 2 daughters. All of them are attending schools and universities. For the past seven years Jamal has been planting his land in seasonal crops and selling them in the local market. It is a good business but requires a lot of effort. His wife and kids help him at harvest time.

Jamal took a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy seeds and seedlings and also buy new water pipes. This will increase his productivity and his income will increase. He appears in the photo on his farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings, and also buy new water pipes.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is a 36-year-old, married woman from a village near Jenin city. She is a mother of five sons and two daughters. Sana's husband sells used items, like furniture. 

Sana has been raising chickens and rabbits for the past ten years. Her husband and children help her on her farm. 

Sana took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to expand the barn where she raises chickens and rabbits. This will help her to increase her productivity and also her income. 

Sana appears in the photo, with her husband.

loans.use: to expand the barn where she raises chickens and rabbits.

loans.name: Nyambura

texts.en:
Nyambura lives in Kongowea, north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a 38-year-old married business lady with four children. She runs a food business in the market and the business has been in operation for the last four years. She also sells lesos (African clothing also called kangas) in the same market. Her business has really grown since its inception and she has managed to employ someone to help her handle the customers. 

She knew about Milango through friends and now she is seeking a loan to buy flour, beans, rice and cooking oil for her food business. She hopes that the business will grow into a reputable restaurant in the next five years despite the challenges of prices and competition. The income raised will improve her living standards and she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, beans, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Esmeralda Isabel

texts.es: Esmeralda de 22 años de edad, habita junto a su familia su compañero de vida y su hijo de 4 años de edad. Viven en su casa humilde pequeña de un solo cuarto desde hace 5 años. Siempre ha querido sobresalir por el bienestar de su hijo, siendo una joven madre luchadora con deseos de superación. Vende tostadas que son rodajas de plátanos y yuca fritas, empanadas y además vende pescado. En esta ocasión se acercó a FUSAI para solicitar un crédito que le permita cambiar el techo de su casa y mejorar las paredes de su humilde vivienda ya que actualmente son de hojas de palmera las que desea sustituirlas por lamina galvanizada, y necesita comprar lamina galvanizada, pines, pagar la mano de obra y cemento. Espera contar con la ayuda y que todo le sea satisfactorio para su familia.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 22 years old and lives with her family, which consists of her life companion and their four-year-old son.  They have been living in a small modest house that consists of one room for the past five years.  Esmeralda has always wanted to do well in life for the benefit of her young son, but being a young a mother, she struggles with her desire to get better.  She sells “tostadas”, which are chips made of fried slices of bananas and cassava.  In addition, she sells empanadas and fish.  

On this occasion, Esmeralda came to FUSAI to request a loan so that she can replace the roof of her house and repair the walls of her modest home.  The walls are currently made of palm leaves, but she wants to substitute them with galvanized metal sheets.  She needs to buy metal sheets, pins, cement, as well as pay for labor.  Esmeralda hopes to have this assistance so that everything will be satisfactory for her family.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, pins, cement, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Josue Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Josué es una persona muy honesta y responsable, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 3 años, la cual es muy visitada y conocida por los vecinos de su comunidad.
Don Josué está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más productos como ser: maíz, manteca, huevos, queso, refrescos, churros, arroz, frijoles, pan, café, mantequilla, carne, jugos, etc. que necesita para surtir más de producto su negocio. 
Don Josué espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucha ayuda ya que gracias a el contara con los insumos necesarios para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y así mismo satisfacer las necesidades de estos, de igual manera espera que sus ventas aumenten y gracias a esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia.
Don Josué el espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que cumplan sus metas y sueños así como el de que puedan  estudiar para que tengan  mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Josué is a very honest and responsible person. He lives in a community in the south of Honduras with his wife and their two children. He has had a small grocery store business for three years that is very popular and well-known among his neighbors in his community.

Josué is asking for the loan to buy more products such as corn, oil, eggs, cheese, drinks, churros, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat, juices, etc., which he needs to stock his business with more products. 

Josué hopes that the loan will serve as a lot of help, as he will have the supplies necessary to cover his customers' demands and thus satisfy their needs. He likewise hopes that his sales increase; in this way he would have more earnings to benefit his family's lifestyle. 

Josué hopes to grow his business and keep supporting his children so that they achieve their goals and dreams as well as ensuring that they are able to study in order to have greater opportunities in life.



Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, eggs, cheese, drinks, churros, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat, juices, etc., for his business

loans.name: Ghaith

texts.en:
Ghaith is a 21-year-old single young man from a small village near Tulkarem city. He lives with his family in a small house. Ghaith's father is a worker in a local company and he gets a low income. The family expenses are too high and he can't pay the university installment for his son. Ghaith is a very clever man and he is in his second year of studying Social Science.

Ghaith took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installment for this semester. This will help him to complete his study and find a job to help his father with part of the expenses. 

Ghaith appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installment for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more toys to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food stock, such as rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electronic tax machines.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Chrisitne est une femme de 31 ans, célibataire sans enfant. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 10 mois où elle a ouvert une boutique dans laquelle elle vend la friperie es vêtements des jeunes, hommes et des dames et des chaussures(en fonction des saisons et des ballots). à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail les chaussures et vêtements qu'elle expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte. Elle économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour ouvrir une boutique de vêtements.
texts.en:
Chrisitne is a 31-year-old woman, single and without children. She has been a merchant in the market place for the past ten months. She runs a counter where she sells used clothing and shoes for young men and women (depending on the season and availability of shoes).

Due to her lack of capital, every weekend Christine must go to purchase at retail the clothing and shoes she sells from her counter. This loan is therefore very important to her for her work, as it will allow her to purchase a mixed bundle of clothing. She will save the income she earns from this loan to open a clothing store.

loans.use: to purchase a mixed bundle of clothing.

loans.name: Qaher

texts.en:
Qaher is a 37-year-old married man from Jenin city. He lives in a small house with his wife and six children; four sons and two daughters. For the past four years, Qaher has been working in his own sewing workshop where he sews different kinds of clothing. It is a profitable job and earns a good income. 

He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy two new sewing machines for his workshop. This will increase his productivity and also his income. 

Qaher appears in the photo in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines for his sewing workshop.

loans.name: Celestiner

texts.en:
Celestiner lives in the Kilifi area which is north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is 26 years old and she is a single business lady. She has been operating a retail shop for more that five years now and the business is growing. She started the business from her personal savings. She knew about Milango through friends and she joined so that she could save and be able to access credit to fund her business. 

She now seeks a loan to buy ten bundles of maize flour and seven sacks of maize to sell in her shop. She hopes that in the next ten years she will open more branches of her business. The extra income that she will raise will help her to buy a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy ten bundles of maize flour and seven sacks of maize.

loans.name: Mofeed

texts.en:
Mofeed is a 29-year-old single man from Attel, a small village near Tulkarem city. 

For the past three years, Mofeed has been working in his farm where he raises chickens to sell its' meat in the local market. It is a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement. 

Mofeed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more feed and chicks for his farm. This will increase his productivity, and  also his income. 

Mofeed appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more feed and chicks for his farm.

loans.name: Samsoni

texts.en:
Samsoni lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a 35-year-old married businessman, and he sells tea in town. He buys tea at wholesale, and sells it at retail. He has been operating the business for the last one and a half years. His business has grown, and he has been able to employ someone to help him run the business. 

He learned of Milango through friends, and now seeks a loan to buy 20 bags of tea leaves to sell. The major challenges in the business are high transportation costs and a shortage of capital. The income that he will raise will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of tea leaves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy childrens clothes, and ladies and mens wear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap and detergents

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es: Rosa Estela de 34 años de edad, habita junto a su compañero de vida y sus cuatros hijos todos menores de edad. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser emprendedora y perseverante.  Actualmente trabaja en un proyecto de limpieza y pintura de su comunidad, que la municipalidad le remunera por horas trabajadas. Su necesidad inmediata es arreglar el corredor de la parte de atrás de su casa y construirle un pasamano; es por esa razón que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo que le permita comprar materiales de construcción como láminas galvanizadas, cemento, ladrillos entre otros. Espera lo antes posible iniciar con la construcción.
texts.en:
Rosa Estela is a 34-year old woman who lives with her life partner and their four minor children. She is a very hard-working person who has always been very determined and has an entrepreneurial spirit. She currently works in a cleaning and painting project in her community and gets compensated by the municipality for the hours worked. 

Her most urgent need is to fix the corridor in the rear of her house and to build a banister. She is requesting a loan with FUSAI to buy construction materials, such as galvanized layers, cement and bricks, among others. She expects the construction to start as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized layers, cement and bricks, among others.

loans.name: Sameerah

texts.en:
Sameerah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son appears in the photo in her store. 

Sameerah is a 47-year-old married woman from a small village near Ramallah City. She is the mother of four sons. Sameerah has a linens store where she and her sons work. She would like to buy some products for the winter season. 

Sameerah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more products for her linens store. 

By using this loan, Sameerah will be able to buy a good quantity of linen products at a low price.

loans.use: to buy more products for her linens store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new machine for her husband's carpentry workshop

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 39 years old and lives in Caldwell. She lives with her husband and four children, aged five to 19. Her four children are presently attending school.

Victoria has been selling fish, frozen chicken, and other items in the local market for ten years now. She started this business with 1,000 Liberian dollars given to her by her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, frozen chicken, etc. for her business. She hopes to build her own house and improve her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, frozen chicken, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 34 years old, married, and has one child; he runs a printing and photocopy business. He has been in this business for the last eight months, and there is a chance that the business will grow in future. He also is a chemist; that gives him extra income. 

He learned of Milango through friends, and he joined so he could save, and access credit. 

He now wants to buy a photocopy machine that will make his work easier. He hopes to be running a bureau in the next five years, despite the challenges of competition and machine breakdown. 

The extra income raised from the loan will be used to pay his child's school fees, and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a photocopy machine

loans.name: Tonny

texts.en:
Tonny lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a 36-year-old single businessman. 

For six years, he has been running a carpentry business that has been feeding him. He learned of Milango through friends, and he joined so that he could save and be able to access credit to fund his business. 

He now seeks a loan to buy timber for woodworking in his work shop. He hopes that in five years time he will be able to own a workshop and a showroom, despite the shortage of customers.  The extra income he will raise will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy timber for woodworking

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es: Epifanio, de 28 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa Nery con quien tiene una pequeña hija a la que cuida en la casa que alquila hace 2 años. Epifanio se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de granos los cuales comercializa en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde tiene buenos compradores, comenta que en un inicio no pensó en este negocio pues sus padres son agricultores y el aprendió este noble oficio. Desde entonces pensó en negociar el mismo sus productos, le va muy bien y no solo comercializa los de sus padres también de otros agricultores, otra de las actividades que emprendió es la compra y venta de animales menores. Ahora se encuentra negociando cada semana los animales de su localidad espera poder aumentar sus ganados y así mejorar en este negocio, donde tiene buenos ingresos. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, espera de un pequeño préstamo para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Epifanio, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de ganado al por mayor para seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Epifanio is a 28-year old responsible man. He lives with his wife, Nery, and their young daughter in a house that he has been renting for 2 years. Epifanio works buying and selling grain in the city of Huancayo, where he has good buyers. He says he initially never though about this business as his parents are farmers and taught them their profession. He negotiates himself and is being successful selling his parents' products and those of other farmers. He also buys and sells small animals and negotiates those in his locality every week. He expects to increase his livestock and to improve his business, where he receives good income. 

This is his first loan with Kiva and he expects it will help him to reach his goals. He also commits to repay as scheduled. Epifanio will invest 1,000 soles in the purchase of livestock in bulk, with an aim to improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single young man from Jenin city. He works as an employee to pay the living costs for him and his parents. Mohammad also is a student in the university, where he studies elementary education so he will become a teacher in the future. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a new laptop to help him with his studies. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and reports easily. This will help him to finish his studies with very good marks and find a job. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to help him in his studies.

loans.name: Umayma

texts.en:
Umayma is a 19-year-old single lady. She lives with her family in a simple house in Jenin City. Her father is a worker in the public sector where he earns a very low wage. This is the only source of income for the family. Umayma's father can't pay her university tuition because of the high household expenses. 

Umayma took a USD $1000 loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay her university tuition installment for this semester. This support will help her to complete her studies and find a good job in the future.

In the photo above, Umayma is studying.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition installment for this semester

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a retail rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Lourdes earns additional income from tailoring.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

She dreams of building and expanding her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria Luisa de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia es una mujer muy trabajadora que vela por si misma. Por como la admiran sus vecinos exclaman de ella que es responsable y muy carismática. Actualmente trabaja como jornalera en la siembra de Loroco (planta nativa de El Salvador cuya flor es comestible). Ella ha tomado la decisión de adquirir un préstamo a FUSAI ya que no tiene el dinero suficiente y desea cambiar el techo de un corredor y encementar el piso y para ello necesita comprar laminas nueva, clavos cemento, arena entre otros materiales. Actualmente el techo está muy deteriorado y en esta época de lluvia les está siendo difícil convivir en dicho espacio. Por lo que espera pronto solventar este problema de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is 51 years old and lives in her own home.  She is a hard-working woman who looks out for herself.  She is admired by her neighbors who say that she is responsible and very charismatic.  She currently works planting Loroco (a plant native to El Salvador whose flower is edible). 

She has decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI because she doesn't have enough money to replace her hallway roof and cement the floor.  To do this she needs new metal sheets, nails, cement, and sand, among other materials.  The roof is in very bad shape and in this rainy season it is very difficult to live in this space, so she hopes to solve her housing problem soon.

loans.use: to buy new metal sheets, nails, cement, and sand, among other construction materials.

loans.name: Floredelina

texts.en:
Floredelina is 50 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 14 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending.

Floredelina has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She is now requesting a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, and spices.

Floredelina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Bebeth Isabel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Bebeth Isabel works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Bebeth Isabel is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell in her general store, such as soap, milk, sugar, and cream.

Bebeth Isabel has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a retail rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Esther earns additional income from raising pigs.

Esther has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Sarah Joy

texts.en:
Sarah Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Sarah Joy earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs.

Sarah Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of items like soft drinks, canned goods, milk, and soap to sell in her general store.

She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Elmer Ernesto

texts.es: Elmer de 28 años de edad habita en casa humilde pero propia desde hace 11 años de edad. Actualmente se desempeña vendiendo ropa nueva y usada con lo que gana solventa los gastos diario de su vida, pero no tiene lo necesario para mejorar su vivienda; es por esa razón que solicito A FUSAI un préstamo que le permita comprar polines metálicos, lamina galvanizada y sustituir la existente ya que debido al humo de la cocina este se encuentra picado y en mal estado. También con parte del dinero podrá solicitar la conexión de energía eléctrica. Espera contar con la ayuda solicitada y solventar dichas necesidades.
texts.en: Elmer is 28 years old and lives in a humble home, but it has been his own since he was 11. He sells new and used clothing and with what he earns he is able to pay his daily living expenses, but he doesn't have enough money to fix up his home.  This is why he is asking FUSAI for a loan.  It will allow him to buy metal poles and sheets of galvanized metal so that he can replace the metal sheets he has now which are full of holes and in bad condition because of the smoke from the kitchen. With part of the loan he will also ask for a connection to the electrical power. He hopes he can count on the help he is asking for so he can take care of these necessities.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets since his are full of holes and in bad condition due to the smoke from the kitchen. He also wants to ask to be connected to the electrical power.

loans.name: Nubia Yamillette

texts.es: Nubia de 24 años de edad vive junto a ocho miembros más de su familia en casa humilde pero propia y esto la hace sentirse satisfecha de lo que hasta ahora ha construido con el esfuerzo de sus manos y el sudor de su frente. Ella se gana la vida con la venta de Semillas de Marañón y dulce de coco rayado. Nubia poco a poco ha ido mejorando su hogar y en esta ocasión desea ampliar un cuarto ya que necesita el espacio mas grande para los demás miembros de su familia, es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo pues no tiene el dinero suficiente y desea comprar cemento, arena, ladrillos, varillas y otros materiales necesarios. Confía en que su vivienda tendrá ese cambio y que seguirá apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Nubia is a 24-year old woman who lives with eight of her family members in a modest house. This house is however of her property, which makes her feel proud of what she has achieved with her effort and hard work. She makes a living selling Semillas de Marañón and sweet coconut. 

Nubia has been improving her house little by little and now would like to make one of the rooms bigger, so that the other members of her family have more space. She does not have enough money to buy cement, sand, bricks, bars and other necessary materials, which is why she is requesting a loan with FUSAI. She believes she will be able to make these improvements and to continue to support her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bars and other necessary materials.

loans.name: Ozodamo

texts.ru: Озодамо трудолюбивая женщина. Она разведена и ей очень было трудно после развода с  мужем справляться с семейными расходами. Она более 23 года занимается купле продажей женской одежды на местном рынке. Она имеет своих клиентов среди местного населения, так как она очень общительная и старается привлечь много клиентов. Она единственная кормилица в семье. Озодамо необходимо подготовится на зиму. Она должна купить печку и дров, так как прошлой зимой ей было очень трудно жить в холодном доме. У нее не было дров, чтобы топить. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки печки и дров. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ozodamo is a hardworking woman.  She is divorced and it was very hard for her to handle the family's expenses after her divorce from her husband.  She has been involved in buying and selling women's clothing at a local market for over 23 years.  She has regular customers among the local residents because she is very outgoing and tries to attract many customers.  She is the sole provider for the family.  Ozodamo needs to prepare for the winter.  She has to purchase a stove heater and wood because it was very hard for her to live in a cold house last winter.  She did not have wood to heat up her house.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 somoni to buy a stove heater and wood.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a stove heater and wood

loans.name: Milady Del Carmen

texts.es: Milady de 37 años de edad, habita su vivienda desde hace seis años junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos pequeños hijos de 3 y 7 años de edad. Es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora que siempre cumple lo que se propone. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo ropa usada por fardos en los mercados. Poco a poco ha ido mejorando su vivienda y en esta ocasión solicitó a FUSAI un préstamo y construir una fosa séptica con paredes de ladrillo de barro, ya que la fosa actual es de hoyo seco con plástico alrededor que sirve como paredes, lo cual no es funcional y poco higiénico. Desea construir lo más pronto posible y se compromete a cancelar la deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
Milady is a 37-year old woman who has lived in her current house with her life partner and their two children, aged 3 and 7, for 6 years. She is very cheerful and hard-working and always achieves her goals. She currently works selling second-hand clothes in street markets. 

She has been improving her house little by little and is now requesting a loan with FUSAI to build a septic tank with walls made of brick. The existing tank is a dry hole with plastic walls, which is not functional or hygienic. She would like to start the construction work as soon as possible and commits to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a septic tank.

loans.name: Melca

texts.en:
Melca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell at her business.

Melca has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from fattening up pigs.

Melca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Wilfredo

texts.es: Nelson de 38 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus 4  hijos menores de edad. Actualmente trabaja como albañil. Junto a su esposa les está costando salir adelante pero por el bien de sus hijos los sigue motiva a continuar esforzándose. Nelson ha solicitado un préstamo a FUSAI para la compra de lamina galvanizada, pines y otros materiales de construcción con el fin de reparar el techo averiado de su humilde vivienda, las lluvias ya han comenzado a afectarles filtrándose el agua y está arruinando sus pocas pertenencias; además con el dinero del crédito comprará los materiales para la introducir y conexión de la energía eléctrica.
texts.en:
Nelson is a 38-year old man who lives with his wife and their four minor children. He currently works as a builder and he and his wife are finding it difficult to get ahead. However, the well being of their children keeps them motivated to work hard. 

Nelson has requested a loan with FUSAI to buy galvanized layers, pins and other construction materials to fix the damaged ceiling of their modest house. The rain is seeping into the house and is damaging their very few belongings. They also plan to use the loan to buy materials to install electricity.

loans.use: to buy galvanized layers, pins and other materials to fix the ceiling and install electricity.

loans.name: Hipolito Gustavo

texts.es:
El señor Hipólito de 45 años de edad vive con su esposa en la aldea la cuesta en donde se dedica a la venta de cargas de leña y de maíz y los fines de semana destaza cerdos y los vende en la misma comunidad.
Don Hipólito sale a vender todos los días de la semana, a diferentes lugares ya que sus clientas son señoras que venden tortillas, y él les lleva el producto para que ella preparen sus ventas.
Don Hipólito está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cargas de leña y salir a vender a diferentes  lugares, es esta muy contento que se le pueda atender.
Don Hipólito su sueño es poder comprarse otro carro para poder transportar su venta. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Septiembre  del 2013.
texts.en:
Hipólito is a 45-year old man who lives with his wife in the town of La Cuesta, where he sells firewood and corn. On weekends, he carves up pigs and sells them in the same community. Hipólito sells his products every day of the week in different places given that his clients are women who sell tortillas and need the products for their businesses. 

Hipólito is requesting a loan to buy firewood and to sell in different localities, and is glad to count on this support. Hipólito's dream is to buy another car to carry his products. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2013

loans.use: to buy firewood for his business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 62 years old and married with five children.

Evangeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell, like canned goods, milk, sugar, chips, and other items.

Evangeline has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running her general store for five years and also earns income from buying and selling cologne and growing vegetables.

Evangeline aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, like canned goods, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Miguela works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Miguela is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables for her business.

Miguela has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 52 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her store like soap, milk, sugar, etc. Wilma has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
Baby is 52 years old and married with four children.

Baby works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store like soap, milk, coffee, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Baby has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from fishing and buying and selling frozen foods.

Baby aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, coffee, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 44 years old and married with three children.

Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries like coffee, milk, canned goods, eggs, soap, and other items.

Marilou has borrowed and paid back 19 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running her general store for five years and also earns an income from selling food.

Marilou aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries like coffee, milk, canned goods, eggs, soap, etc.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 54 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Linda is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Linda has been farming rice for eight years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and a general store. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to re-sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her businesses.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to re-sell

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is 56 years old and married with five children.

Haide works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

Haide has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a boarding house.

Haide aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Eva is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.

Eva has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Eva has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Eva would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina is 48 years old and married with five children.

Lucina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items such as spices, canned goods, shampoo, milk, eggs, etc.

Lucina has borrowed and repaid 30 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from buy and sell vegetables.

Lucina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items such as spices, canned goods, shampoo, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 56 years old and married, with five children.

Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for four years, and she also earns an income from selling frozen foods.

Emma aspires to save money to expand her business and to repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 39 years old and married with one child.

Ester works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ester has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 3 years and also earns an income from fishing and coconut grinding.

Ester aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase stock to sell such as chips, canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell such as chips, canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy stocks to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, cream, etc for her general store business.

Crisanta has been in this business for 10 years. Crisanta earns more income from tricycle transport and a restaurant.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Crisanta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, cream, etc

loans.name: Ma. Merlita

texts.en:
Ma. Merlita is 46 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Merlita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Merlita requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Ma. Merlita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ma. Merlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Daisy works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell yakult business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from general store.  Daisy is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additibonal boxes of yakult to sell for her buy and sell yakult business.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additibonal boxes of yakult to sell

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 60 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Dioscora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, soft drinks, chips, eggs, etc. to sell.

Dioscora has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Dioscora would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, soft drinks, chips, eggs, etc, to sell

loans.name: Pregrina

texts.en:
Pregrina is 28 years old and she is now applying for a loan of USD 1,000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of USD 40. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stocks to keep in her store, such as noodles, water, ice, Fanta, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, Coca-cola, and body lotion. Pregrina is a very hard-working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. 

She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, water, ice, Fanta, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, and Coca-cola for her business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 28 years old and married with five children.

Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell such as coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc.

Analyn has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buy and sell coconut wine.

Analyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell such as coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda is 28 years old and has one child. She works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling coconut wine business in the Philippines. Florinda is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell for her buying and selling coconut wine business.

Florinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Chloe

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Chloe works hard to support her family.

She has a purified drinking water business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling sea shells. Chloe is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Chloe sustained her business activities in the past with three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Helma

texts.en:
Helma is 51 years old and married with eight children.

Helma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 9,500 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase grocery products to sell.

Helma has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running her general store for three years and also earns an income from selling rice.

Helma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, 43 years of age, is married and blessed with six children. Gemma manages a grocery store in their village for almost ten years. With this business, she is earning a net income of PHP 2,000 daily. 

She would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to purchase rice grains, canned goods, biscuits, candies, noodles, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more progressive and more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase rice grains, canned goods, biscuits, candies, noodles, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
This is Freddie, 48, resident of Payatas, Philippines. He is married to Josephine, a housewife and they have children. Together, they manage their household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Freddie operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops, then, stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, like factories and others of the like. 

Freddie's regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 (Philippine Pesos) in sales, every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, Freddie is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. He will be incorporating the loan on his current revolving fund, used to buy trash from collectors. 

Freddie dreams of expanding his business and having another branch. He hopes to give a good life to his family. 

Every week, Freddie meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.pt:
Vicente é segurança interno ha 11 anos  duma empresa do ramo agrίcola e trabalha das 6 as 16 horas no turno de dia se fizer da noite e das 16 as 06 horas, tem 51 anos de idade e casado ha 20 anos tem 5 filhos dos quais 4 estudam e 1 já maior de idade e  sustenta 4 netos que vivem com ele.
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, pedra, varrões para concluir a sua obra.
Diz que tem como planos continuar a dar acompanhamento aos estudos de seus filhos e concluir sua obra.
Compromete se a pagar pontualmente nas datas previstas e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar os seus planos.
texts.en:
Vicente has been a security guard for an agricultural company for 11 years. He works from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. on the day shift and from 4 p.m. to 6 a.m. if he gets the night shift. He's 51 years old and has been married for 20 years. He has five children, four of whom study and one is already an adult. He supports four grandchildren who live with him.
With the amount of the loan he'll purchase cement, rocks and rods so he can finish his construction work.
He pledges to repay the loan in a timely fashion on the scheduled dates. He also states that he'll request more loans so that he can accomplish his plans.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rocks and rods.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris is 33 years old and married with one kid.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Mary Cris is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

Mary Cris has been raising ducks for two years and also earns additional income from selling rice.

She works tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Remia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by selling food. Remia is borrowing 8,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more rice to sell to customers.

Remia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
This is Gregoria. She previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gregoria dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a happy family in spite of difficulties. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
This is Anabel, 25, a resident of Batasan, Quezon CIty, Philippines. Her partner is Andy, a construction worker, and they have children. She and her partner manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anabel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help her continue to operate her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Anabel dreams that her variety store will grow bigger and hopes to give her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Felicidade

texts.en:
Felicidade is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 30 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as buy body lotion, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, cigarettes, milk, eggs, water, slippers, soaps, noodles, fish canes, oil, sugar, biscuits and rice. 

She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. She is living in a town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy including students.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, cigarettes, milk, eggs, water, slippers, soaps, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by selling frozen food and jewellery.  Mary Ann is borrowing 11,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to resell.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to resell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 29 years old.  She is married and has three children.  She is running a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as fish, cigarettes, milk, salt, coffee, sugar, soap, noodles, Sagiko, Sprite, Fanta and beer.  She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.  Maria is living in a town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people, including students, come to buy from her.

loans.use: To buy fish, cigarettes, milk, salt, coffee, sugar, soap, noodles, Sagiko, Sprite, Fanta and beer

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Juliana works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling copras [the dried meat of a coconut] in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by selling dried fish. Juliana is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more copras to resell.

Juliana has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more copras to resell.

loans.name: Daria

texts.es: Daría, de 52 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía de 2 de sus 10 hijos a los que cuida con mucho amor, pues quedó viuda hace mucho tiempo. Ahora vive en la casa que compra hace 30 años. Nació en el campo y aprendió desde entonces a nutrir los campos y sacar el mayor provecho de todo lo que le enseñaron, cuando era joven formó su familia y desde entonces trabaja con mucho esmera en la agricultura labrando por ella misma la tierra y cuidándola con mucho esmero. Posee muchas hectáreas de terreno donde siembra, maíz, papa, alverja y hasta flores diversas. Ahora se encuentra un poco enferma de salud, pues tiene problemas cardiacos, pero aún así desea seguir trabajando en el campo, donde espera poder vivir tranquila el resto de sus días. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, espera de un pequeño préstamo para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Daría, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Daría, 52 years old, is a responsible woman. She lives with 2 of her 10 children and cares for them lovingly. She has been a widow for a long time. Now she lives in the house she bought 30 years ago. 

She was born in the countryside and learned since then to nourish the fields and to take advantage of everything she was taught. When she was young she started a family and since then she has worked in agriculture. She herself has plowed the land carefully attending to it. She has many hectares of land where she grows corn, potatoes, peas and even various flowers. Now she has been a little sick, having heart problems, but still she wants to continue working on the farm, where she hopes to be able to live peacefully until the end of her days.

This is her first loan with Kiva. She is hoping for a small loan in order to achieve her plans, and she agrees to complete her payments in a timely manner. Daría will invest the 1500 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer in order to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Serason Indah Group

texts.en:
Serason Indah Group continues to borrow from MUK and they have elected a new head, Ni Made. The group has seven members and a total loan of 24.5 million IDR. 

Ni Made is very happy to get loans from MUK, because in addition to the training she receives, she obtains funds without collateral, specifically for pig farmers. Ni Made lives with her husband, who works as a farmer, and two children. The first child works in the city and the second child is still in school. In addition to her pig-raising business, Ni Made has a kiosk where sells snacks. Her loan will be used to buy two piglets and feed. She plans to expand her kiosk with the profit from raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and feed.

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en: Pedrito, age 45, is a furniture maker, particularly making sofas. He has been in this industry for 20 years now and slowly creates his own name in this line of business.  His dream in the business is high.  He feels that he can achieve it with strong determination and sufficient revolving funds thus requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to fill in his capital insufficiency.  It will be used to buy wood, a basic material in making sofas.  He would be very glad for his requested loan to be provided.

loans.use: to buy wood, a basic material in making sofas.

loans.name: Mernafe

texts.en:
Mernafe is single with one child, residing in Poblacion, Aurora. For more than five years of being in a service-based type of business activity, Mernafe earns a monthly income of PHP 8,000. Her previous loan from GDMPC that was used to purchase spare parts and accessories was successfully repaid.

Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 50,000 PHP to cover the costs of motor repair and accessories. Mernafe hopes to expand her business and to gain more income.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motor repair and accessories.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. 

She is running a kiosk that helps her generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), cigarettes, coffee, sugar, milk, eggs, noodles and soap. 

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Maria is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), cigarettes, coffee, sugar, milk, eggs, noodles and soap.

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Soeng is 49 years old, married, and a loving father of three children. He lives with his family in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham province. 

To earn a living, he is involved in farming and a motor-repairing business, the income from which he is able to use to cover the costs of living. He has his wife and children who help him with the maintenance of the rice field during rainy season.

This loan is to buy a cow, kept for the purpose of producing young animals. The cow might bear calves two times per three years, so he will be able to sell them for a profit in the future. Also, with a portion of the loan, he will invest in the purchase of spare motor parts for his repair shop, located in his home. 

His dreams are to continue progressing with his businesses and to have better income and good health.

loans.use: to buy a cow, kept for the purpose of producing young animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Kathia Mayela

texts.es: La señora Kathia, es madre soltera de dos hijos de las edades de 9 y 17 años de edad, que asisten a la escuela primaria y secundaria. Tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación, a donde llegan a comprar sus vecinos, que son sus principales clientes, y gracias a esta actividad comercial, garantiza el pan de cada día y educación de sus hijos. Kathia solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio con refrescos, jugos, carne, pollo, verduras. Que le permitan mantener sus ingresos diarios y así poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Kathia is a single mother of two children who are 9 and 17 years old and attend primary and secondary school. She has a small grocery store which she runs out of her home and her main customers are her neighbors.  Thanks to this work she is able to earn her daily bread and educate her children. Kathia is asking for this loan to invest in her business by buying soft drinks, juices, meat, chicken and vegetables.  This will allow her to maintain her daily income and meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juice, meat, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie is married and has two children. His wife is working as an Overseas Filipino Worker while he operates their rice and corn buy-and-sell business to make a living. 

He has been doing this business and earning at least 20,000 PHP monthly. He borrowed a loan of 35,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to buy more rice and corn to resell. 

He always finds ways to augment their living, and hopes to improve the general living situation of the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more rice and corn to resell.

loans.name: Jurilyn

texts.en:
Jurilyn is a wife of a government employee, and they live in Zamboanga del Sur with their two children. To make a living, she manages her piggery, raising pigs for sale as an aid to her husband's income. 

She joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feeds and additional piglets. She plans to use her profit to expand her piggery to gain more income in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and additional piglets.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es: Pastor mayor de edad, casado con seis hijos todos mayores de edad originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país donde predomina el ron, la azucar y la caña al igual que existe uno de los ingenios mas grandes de nuestro pai, pastor se dedica a la siembre de pipianes, platanos, maiz, ayote entre otros mas tambien a la venta de mariscos especialmente pescado, el inicio su negocio desde hace 35 años, al principio lo tomo como algo temporal, pero luego lo tomo como el medio de subsistencia para su familia y así poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, el vende sus productos de manera ambulante en sectores aledaños a su domicilio, las compras las realiza en uno de los municipios del departamento al contado, uno de sus sueños es poder tener una estabilidad económica en su familia y poder tener mejores ingresos para mejorar su negocio, él solicita crédito para la compra de capital de trabajo invirtiento en compra de pescado, urea, semillas de pipian, ayote, maiz entre otros, el cual le ayudara con las mejoras de ingresos en su negocio
texts.en:
Pastor, who is over the age of majority, is married and has six adult children. He is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country, where rum, sugar and cane production dominate. One of the biggest factories in the country is also located there.

Pastor works sowing squash seeds, bananas, corn, and acorn squash, among other crops. He also works selling seafood, especially fish. He started his business 35 years ago. At the beginning he saw it as something temporary, but then it became the main means of subsistence for his family, and it was through this business that he was able to help his children to get ahead. 

Pastor sells his products as a street vendor in the areas surrounding his home. He makes his purchases in cash in one of the municipalities in his region. 

One of his dreams is to provide his family with economic stability and to have better earnings in order to improve his business. He is requesting this loan for working capital to invest in buying fish, urea, squash seeds, acorn squash and corn, among other items. This will help him to improve his earnings at his business.

loans.use: for working capital to invest in buying fish, urea, squash seeds and banana seedlings.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 37 years old, married, and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school.  Her spouse plants and harvests rice to sell, while she works for her niece as a nanny to have extra income weekly. She would like to improve her spouse's  farming business and is seeking a loan of PHP10,000 to buy insecticides and herbicides for their rice farming.  From this, she will be able to help her spouse improve and develop growth and nutrition for their crops for a better yield someday.   She also hopes to keep educating her children and see them as professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and herbicides for rice farming.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is from Anonang, Aurora. She is married and has three children. To make a living, Jesusa manages her own general store, located in the community of Aurora. She has been doing this for more than seven years to make a living. 

Her previous loan that was used in her business was successfully repaid. She borrowed a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase grocery goods in cans, noodles, sugar and rice for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods in cans, noodles, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Edelie

texts.en:
This is Edelie, 53, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Cristituto, an employee, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Edelie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Edelie hopes to be a successful businesswoman and dreams to see her children successful in their chosen careers.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is married and has one child. Her husband is a farmer, while she manages raising pigs to make a living.  In 2007, she joined Gata Daku MPC and recently she borrowed 10,000 PHP to purchase feeds to be used in her piggery. She planns to expand her business and be able to use the profit for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase feeds

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 32 years old and married.  She is a resident of Tuyabang, Bajo, Oroquieta City. She earns a living through direct selling, earning a meager income of Php 3000 per month. 

She is a member of PMPC, and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now she is applying for a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase more inventories of clothing like lingerie, blouses, pants and others to sell.  Jean deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories of clothing like lingerie, blouses, pants and others to sell

loans.name: Wilson Sr.

texts.en:
Wilson is from Tagodalo, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur.  He is married and has two children. 

To earn a living, Wilson owns and operates an agricultural business venture raising crops. The main source of income from the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables and bananas to sell.  Aside from farming, he also helps his wife operate their sari-sari store.

His previous loan from GDMPC that was used for farm inputs has successfully been repaid. Recently, he borrowed a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase grocery items such as sardines, sugar, noodles, etc for sale in their store.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as sardines, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bracelets, necklaces, rings and hairbands.

loans.name: Muniran

texts.en:
Muniran is a 50 year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a restaurant in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of delicious food. All the customers love the food he delivers. Presently, he needs money to purchase a variety of food items and crockery so that he can continue his work.  Therefore, his wife, Muniran, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of food items and continue delivering delicious dishes. With the help of the loan, he wants to purchase crockery as well. This will help him to continue generating income.

Muniran is a responsible mother.  She dreams of providing a quality education for her children. She wishes for a successful future for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of food items and crockery

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 19 year-old single young woman from Jabalia city.  She is a student in university where she studies in commerce college. She is in her first year.  Taghreed's father is an employee in the public sector, and his is the only source of income for the family.  Taghreed's father can't pay the university installments for his daughter because of high family expenses. 
Taghreed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester so she can complete her studies. This will insure her a better life in the future.
