Taghreed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester so she can complete her studies

loans.name: Villa

texts.en:
Villa is 55 years old, married, and lives at Mitazan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. In order to earn a living she raises poultry located in their neighborhood. With a desire to earn more, she decided to increase the number of chickens.
 
Through Paglaum MPC, she obtained the capital to start up her poultry business. Now, she requests a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional bags of feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a chicken cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of feed for her poultry

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 27 years old and married to a farmer. They make a living through rice farming which they inherited from their parents. They plant and harvest rice to sell and also pay for laborers who help them in the farming business. Corazon would like to achieve an abundant harvest so she is in need of additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. This will help nourish her crops, leading to a bigger crop production for a better yield someday. Corazon and her spouse have no children yet but they are not losing their hope to have one someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Daudi

texts.en:
Daudi runs a retail shop in Tala town, and he has been in the business for 14 years. He is 61 years old and married, with three children, ages 18, 15 and 12 years.

This will be his sixth loan term, and he plans to use the loan to add stocks of goods to sell in his business. These include rice, flour, sugar, and soap. 

He anticipates making more profits, which he will use to educate his children.  His future hopes are to open another shop.

loans.use: To add more stocks of goods to sell.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is from Talic, Oroquieta City.  She is 34 years old and is married.  She has one school-aged child. 

In 2008, Lyn applied for her membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Lyn asked for financial assistance of Php 14,900 to purchase additional kilos of glutonous rice and inventories for her store. Through this she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of glutonous rice and inventories for her store

loans.name: Palmira

texts.en: A $1.000 loan is offered to Palmira to improve her business. Palmira opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, like milk ,eggs, noodles, fish, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, water, Sagiko, Coca cola, Fanta, Sprite and slippers. She is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business.  Palmira is living in town with her family.

loans.use: To buy milk, eggs, noodles, fish, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, water, Sagiko, Coca cola, Fanta, Sprite and slippers

loans.name: Daniela Mercedes

texts.es: Daniela es madre soltera vive en casa de un familiar con su hijo y su padre de 89 años de edad, ella posee una sala de belleza ubicada en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela ya que es un lugar muy transitado y por la calidad con la que ella trabaja, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Daniela esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una plancha y una secadora para el cabello, químicos y keratina  para hacer alisados, ya que los clientes están solicitando mucho ese trabajo y así ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daniela is a single mother who lives in her own house with her son and her 89 year old father. She has a beauty salon located in her residence. She has lots of clients as it is a busy area and she does quality work. With the revenue she makes from her business she pays some of the household expenses. 

Daniela is requesting a loan to buy a hair straightener and a hair dryer, chemicals and keratin to straighten hair. A lot of her clients are asking for this treatment. Doing these treatments she can make more income and give her family a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a hair straightener and a hair dryer, chemicals and keratin.

loans.name: Simplicio

texts.en: Simplicio is married and has three children.  He lives in Kahayagan East, Aurora.  Simplicio has operated a vending business selling food and snacks. He uses his motorcycle to deliver his food and earns a monthly income of 15,000 PHP.  Aside from vending, he also offers motor transportation services in his community to earn additional income for his family. His previous loan from GDMPC, which was used to repair his motorcycle, was successfully repaid. Recently, he requested a new loan of 20,000 PHP  to a buy new set of tires and to purchase raw ingredients. He plans to use the profit from his business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires, and to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
This is Amelita, 45, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Renato, a driver, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Amelita operates a school supplies business. It is where one can buy school supplies, like pens, bond paper, cartolina and the like, without going to a bookstore. She gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She also has a variety store and a food stall for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 700 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy school supplies to expand her product inventory. She will also use the loan for buying grocery items and toiletries.

Amelita hopes to have a general merchandise business one day and dreams to be successful in life and business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for school supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Bentar

texts.en: Bentar lives in Mombasa, Kenya where she runs a retail shop. She has been in this business for the last six years, and the business is doing fine. She is a single mother of four, and two of them still attend school. She also sells fresh milk in her business. She knew of Milango through friends, and she seeks a loan to buy retail products like flour, cookiing oil and bread for sale in the business. She hopes that the business expands to wholesale in the next five years. The challenges in the business include lack of capital and competition. She will use the extra income to educate her children and provide them with food and shelter.

loans.use: to buy retail products like flour, cooking oil and bread

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 52 years old and is married with three children.

Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Fe aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia de 37 años, está casada con José y tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Eulalia es una mujer  emprendedora, hace tan solo 7 años, que inició la siembra de maca los cuales siembra en terrenos de la comunidad, que son alejados y hermosos. Primero, vendía su producción a los intermediarios que trasladaban sus cosechas a la ciudad de Junín, al ver que la maca que producía, era de buena calidad, hace 3 años que Eulalia, recibió la propuesta de vender su producción a una empresa procesadora de bebidas a base de maca en la capital, desde entonces comenzó su inversión en la mejora de la calidad de su producto, el cual le genera muy buenas ganancias. Por ello está planeando abrir su propia empresa de procesadora de maca, con el cual pueda expandir su negocio y por ende generar mejores ganancias, en corto plazo. Este es su tercer crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Eulalia, invertirá los S/.1200 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de maca.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 37 years old and married to Jose. She lives with him and her four children in her own home. Eulalia is described as a person with an entrepreneurial spirit, who just seven years ago started growing maca [Peruvian ginseng] in the remote and beautiful fields of her community. At first, she sold her harvest to middlemen who transported it to the city of Junín. Eulalia says that the buyers saw that her maca was very good quality, and three years ago she received an offer to sell her harvest to a processing company in the capital that makes maca-based beverages. Since that time, Eulalia has invested in improving the quality of her crop, which she says has made her a very good profit. She hopes to open her own maca processing plant so that she can expand her business and improve her income in the near future.

This is Eulalia’s third Kiva loan. She says that she is grateful for the financial support she receives to move ahead with her business, and she promises to make her payments on time. Eulalia will use this loan of 1,200 PEN to buy organic fertilizer for her crop of maca.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her crop of maca [Peruvian gingseng].

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29 year-old single young man from Jabalia city. For the past four years, Mohammad has been working on a small sheep farm he owns.  He sells their meat in the local market. It is a good business but needs big capital. Mohammad would like to improve his business, especially since Eid is coming next month and people buy a lot of meat.
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep to raise at his farm, especially for the Eid season. This will improve his business and he will be able to meet the demand in the market. 
Mohammad appears in the photo in his farm

loans.use: to buy more sheep to raise for his farm, especially for the Eid season

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 57 years old and lives with her six children in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her eldest son has been running a mobile phone shop for a couple of years and earning sufficient income. He sells mobile accessories like chargers, data cables, phone bodies, and offers recharging facilities for different networks.

He took a mobile hardware course for his business, which he has now completed. Along with selling accessories, he also wants to provide mobile repair services. However, he does not have the savings to buy electronic components such as speakers, microphones, diodes, cathodes, LCD screens, etc., or mobile accessories. Therefore, Shamim is requesting a loan for her son, so that he can be empowered to buy additional accessories and electronic components for resale.

Shamim says thanks to Kiva and its field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy mobile accessories and electonic components for repairing.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en:
Jefferson is studying a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science at Western Mindanao State University. He is a fourth-year student. His mother is a government employee while his father had a business. 

He is the third of four children and it is not easy for his parents to support all their needs financially. He always finds ways to lessen this problem. He joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay his first-semester school tuition fees. His hope is that he will finish his studies and get a job to have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to pay his first-semester school tuition fees.

loans.name: Venancio

texts.en:
This is Venancio, 56, who is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, in the Philippines. He is married to his business partner, Jovita, and they have children. Together with his wife, he manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Venancio operates a business buying and selling merchandise. What he basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and then he sells it at a small profit. His products are footwear, sandals and other similar items. Customers are attracted to his business due to the low selling prices and the many options he offers. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 3000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

He also sells fish and different vegetables for additional income.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. He will be utilizing the loan to buy a larger quantity and variety of sandals and slippers to expand his inventory of products.

Venancio dreams that his business will continue to grow and hopes that his children will finish their studies. He meets up every week with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that he studies. 

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity and variety of sandals and slippers to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 53 years old; she is living with her husband happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

For many years her husband has conducted a shop in which he sells tires for vehicles. He is a very noble and honest person.  He takes a very low profit over his sales price; this is the reason many people like to buy tires from him. 

The people trust him, according to his good behavior.  Most of the people borrow money several times and purchase goods on credit. Most of his customers pay back their debts on time, but some customers pay after a long time. His shop is going well and earning a sufficient amount to support his family. 

Nowadays tire prices have increased a lot, so he could not buy his full stock to fulfill the demand of his valued customers. 

Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan for her husband from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband would be able to buy new tires and could keep continue his business smoothly.

Shehnaz says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy vehicle tires for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Régine

texts.fr: Régine est une jeune femme de 26 ans fiancée, mère d'un enfant âgé de 8 ans. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis deux ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de son enfant, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future
texts.en:
Régine is a 26-year-old woman who is engaged to be married. She is the mother of an 8-year-old child. 

After her training, she opened a hair salon that she has been running for two years. She often finds herself in difficulty in her salon due to a lack of cosmetics, hair extensions, and hair grafts. This happens because she buys her products at retail. 

Her goal is to satisfy her clients and to earn a large profit. She is asking for a loan in order to buy a large quantity of supplies. This would allow her to achieve her goals. 

The profit she earns from this loan will allow her to meet her needs, those of her child, and save so that she can grow her business in the future.

loans.use: Increase her stock of hair extensions and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Eveline Rénée

texts.fr: est une jeune femme de 26 ans fiancée, mère d'un enfant âgé de 8 ans. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis deux ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de son enfant, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future
texts.en: [Eveline] is a 26-years old woman, in a relationship, and the mother of an eight-year old child. After her training, she opened her own hair salon and has been managing it for two years already. She often faces running out of stock on cosmetic products, hair extensions and weaves because she buys her products retail. Her goal is to meet her customers’ needs and earn a sizeable profit. She is seeking a loan in order to be able to stock up her supplies in large quantities as this well allow her to meet her goals. The revenues resulting from this loan will allow her to provider for herself and her child as well as to save funds for a future growth of her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of hair extensions and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.fr: La cliente Muhamiriza est une commerçante et membre du groupe  d’affaire «  Blessing », âgée  de 36 ans mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est vendeuse de souliers.  Son conjoint, lui aussi est un Enseignant. Elle a sollicité un crédit  auprès de Hekima. Elle va  acheter dix paires de souliers pour accroitre son capital.  Elle avait commencé avec ses fonds propre reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir il souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Muhamiriza is a shopkeeper and a member of the borrowing group "Blessing." She is 36 years old and the mother of 8 children, all of whom attend school. She is a shoe seller. Muhamiriza's husband is a teacher.

She is requesting a loan through Hekima. She plans on purchasing ten pairs of shoes to increase her stock. Muhamiriza started her business with her own funds received from her husband. In the future she hopes to educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for their support of small business entrepreneurs not eligible for traditional banking.

loans.use: to purchase ten pairs of shoes

loans.name: Sabira

texts.ru: Сабире 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Сабиры- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Сабира занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сабиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 14 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сабира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сабира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Sabira is 51 and married; she and her husband are raising three children. Sabira has a high school education and raises livestock as the primary source of income for her family, something she started eight years ago with the purchase of cattle for 5,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has four milk cows and 14 sheep on her farm, with a monthly income of 7,000 KGS. With the intent of further developing her farm, Sabira has turned to microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 120,000 KGS to buy cows and increase the size of her herd. Income from the loan will be invested into further augmentation of her number of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Boio Ernest

texts.fr:
Monsieur  BOIO ERNEST est âgé de 41 ans et vit avec son épouse et ses trois enfants dans la sous préfecture de Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
BOIO ERNEST est un pasteur de profession, qui très tôt  s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des poussins de race améliorée. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand éleveur et commerçant de volaille. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier prêt qui servira à acheter des poussins  qu’il élèvera pendant deux mois et les revend aux grossistes  au comptant à une clientèle mixte.
BOIO ERNEST espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen bimestriel de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Boio Ernest is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Ouelessebougou division of the region of Koulikoro. He is a shepherd by trade, who early on became interested in business, specifically in the purchase and sale of genetically superior chicks. He learned this business from his maternal uncle, who was already a large poultry raiser and trader.

In order to meet the needs of his growing customer base, Boio Ernest decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first loan, which he will use to purchase chicks that he will raise for two months and then resell wholesale for cash to a customer base made up of both men and women. He hopes to earn an average bi-monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA which he will use to pay back the loan and to reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en:
Yvette is 35 years old. She is engaged in managing a “sari-sari” (variety) store business. She has been doing this for over two years and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 each month. 

She is anxious because her income every month is not enough to sustain her family's immediate needs, so she is requesting a loan to buy stocks of cooking oil, sugar, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks and more. These goods are easy to sell. She hopes to exceed her current profit to pay for her obligations and be able to save for their everyday needs, especially for the educational purposes of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of cooking oil, sugar, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks and more.

loans.name: Gladis Del Carmen

texts.es: Gladys de 44 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija d 19 años de edad ella estudia actualmente, Gladys está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mas ropa por mayor como: blusas,  faldas, ropa interior para damas y caballeros, etc.  Y así poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gladys is 44 years old and has made her living selling clothing for several years. Her business is located in the market found near her house. 

With what she earns from her work, she is able to pay for several expenses that are presented in her house. She lives in her own house with her husband and her daughter, who is 19 and currently studying. 

Gladys is asking for a loan to buy wholesale clothing, such as blouses, skirts and underwear for women and men, etc so she can earn better income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothes: blouses, skirts, underwear for women and men, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es: Rosa de 48 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa alquilada con su hijo de 28 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de licuados y refrescos,  su negocio está ubicado en el parqueo que se encuentra cerca de su casa, es una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee mucha clientela que la buscan por la higiene con que prepara su venta, Rosa solicita un crédito para la compra de frutas, leches, azúcar, vainilla, etc. para seguir preparando los licuados y refrescos  y así obtener mejores gana para tener una mejor calidad de vida con su hijo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48 years old single mother living in a rented house with her 28 year old son. She makes her living selling smoothies and soft drinks. 

Her business is located in a park close to her house in a well-traveled area. Because of this, she has many customers who look for her because of the cleanliness she prepares her products with. 

Rosa is asking for a loan to buy fruits, milks, sugar, vanilla, etc. to continue preparing smoothies and drinks, and so earn better income to have a better quality of life with her son.

loans.use: to buy fruits, milks, sugar, vanilla, etc.

loans.name: Mavjigul

texts.ru: Мавчигул 37 лет. Она замужем и имеет четырех детей. У нее нет высшего образования, и нигде ранее не работала. Но 5 лет назад она открыла свой магазин по продажам хозяйственного товара и разной парфюмерии. Муж все эти годы усердно помогает ей в купле-продаже товара. Мавчигул старательная, ответственная и все время хочет узнать все новое. На данный момент Мавчигул хочет расшириться и пополнить свой магазин новыми товарами, такими как мыло, стиральный порошок, моющие средства и другие хозяйственные принадлежности потому что такие товары востребованы и быстро расходятся. Она легко закупила бы новый товар, но у нее мало денег. Для закупа Мавчигул просит кредит. Она очень хочет угадить своим старым клиентам и приобрести новых.
texts.en: Mavjigul is 37 years old. She is married and has four children. She does not have a college degree and was not employed before. However, five years ago she opened her own store selling household goods and various perfumes and cosmetics. Her husband has been diligently helping her to buy and resell her goods. Mavjigul is hard-working, responsible and always wants to learn new things. At present she would like to expand her business and buy new goods for her store, such as soap, laundry detergent, cleaning supplies and other household goods, because such items are in demand and sell out quickly. She could have easily restocked her merchandise but lacks sufficient funds. Mavjigul is requesting a loan to stock up on merchandise. She would really like to keep her existing customers happy as well as attract new ones.

loans.use: to stock up on household goods and increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es madre soltera vive en casa de un familiar junto con su hijo de 4 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas: dulces, galletas, etc. en la entrada del parque que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercadería por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo y daré a su hijo lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client is a single mother who lives in a family member's house together with her four year-old son. 

She earns her living selling sweets: candies, cookies, etc. in the entrance of the park located near her residence. With what she earns from her sales, she can afford some household expenses. 

The client is asking for a loan to buy bulk merchandise to continue with her work and will give her son what he needs without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy bulk merchandise: candies, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda does farming in Kangundo town where she plants cash crops as well as keeping cattle. She is 45 years old and married, with five children. Her husband also provides income to support the family.

This, being her second loan term, Roda plans to use the amount to buy fertilizer for use on her farm. She also plans to buy more stock of cattle feed for her cattle. She plans to buy another cow with the anticipated profits. 

In the future, Roda hopes to be a successful businesswoman and also install electricity in her home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cattle feed.

loans.name: Atoalama Group

texts.fr:
ATOALAMA est un groupe de l’association CONFIANCE de KANGARE. Il regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments  et d’habillements à l’image de MAMOU  qui est la troisième personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KANGARE dans la  préfecture de YANFOLILA (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt solidaire. 
MAMOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à KANGARE et elle  excelle dans la vente de d’habillement. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 pièces de pagne wax et de bazin.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et vend ses articles à KANGARE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Atoalama is a sub-group of "Confiance de Kangare" ("Confidence of Kangare".) It is made up of 5 women who came to knew each other by way of parentage and as neighbors. They have an average age of 35 years, are married, and have an average of 4 children each. They each operate different small business such as the purchase and sale of spices and clothing.

Mamou is one of these women, and is the third person pictured standing from left to right. The women live in traditional larger families in Kangare in the district of Yanfolila (a region of Sikasso, Mali.) They have each been in business for several years and their products are in high demand. In order to meet the growing needs of their customers, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. The women are on their first group loan.

Mamou, who is the president of the group and very well known in Kangare, runs a successful business in the sale of clothing. She plans to use her loan to purchase 10 pieces of pagne cloth made of wax and of brocade. She stocks up in Bamako and sells her clothing in Kangare, at retail, for cash and for credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. Mamou hopes to earn a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA which will allow her to pay back the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es: Maria de Lourdes con varios ciclos de créditos en AFODENIC, solicita nuevamente un refinanciamiento para continuar con la obra que hace algún tiempo ya empezó, y es la de poner el techo en su vivienda, esta vez techará el porche, ya que actualmente el zinc está deteriorado. Ella trabaja en un cafetín junto a su hermana. Su esposo tiene un taxi, y de esta manera es como ambos sacan adelante a su familia. Espera en un futuro poder ver su casa totalmente acondicionada a las necesidades de su familia. Con el crédito comprará perlines, láminas de zinc, pintura anticorrosiva.
texts.en:
Maria de Lourdes has had several loan cycles in AFODENIC. 

She is again seeking refinancing to continue the project which began some time ago: to put a roof on her house. This time, she will roof the porch, as the zinc is currently deteriorated. 

She works in a cafe together with her sister. Her husband has a taxi, and in this way both of them help their family get ahead. She hopes in the future to be able to live in a house completely equipped for her family's needs. 

With the loan, she will buy structural tubing, zinc sheets and anti-corrosive paint.

loans.use: to buy structural tubing, zinc sheets and anti-corrosive paint.

loans.name: Bekin

texts.ru: Бекин 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Бекин - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бекин занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бекин, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 3 кобылы, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бекин обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бекин планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Bekin is 58 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising six children.  She has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income.  She started in this business five years ago with the purchase of livestock for 6,000 som (KGS).

Thanks to Bekin's hard work, her farming business now comprises three dairy cows, three mares and 20 head of sheep. She makes a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her animal husbandry business, Bekin has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 130,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to buy some cows in order to increase her cattle headcount.

Bekin plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further increasing her livestock headcount. She is also planning to save enough money to perform some repairs at home.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nely, de 51 años, está casada con José y tiene 3 hijos; todos ellos mayores de edad. Ahora ella vive sola con su esposo en su casa propia. Hace 20 años que se dedica a la elaboración de tapices, mantas de lana, ponchos y demás tejidos a base de lana sintética y de algodón. Con el tiempo, dedicación y trabajo, logró abrir un puesto en la casa del artesano, que queda al lado de la municipalidad de su distrito, punto de encuentro de los turistas que llegan a la zona. Pero como mujer emprendedora ella, también tiene un carro, que hace trasporte público en las rutas de Tarma – Lima. Ahora Nely, está planeando viajar a diferentes ferias del país, donde puede expandir su negocio. Ahora se encuentra tejiendo chalinas y gorras para el frío, por ello necesita de su ayuda para adquirir más mercadería para continuar con su negocio.
Este es su tercer crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. Invertirá los 2000 soles solicitados en la compra de artesanía, para surtir su tienda y para adquirir más lanas de colores y así elaborar sus productos textiles.
texts.en:
Nely, 51, is married to Jose and has 3 grown children.  She now lives just with her husband in her own home.  She's been making wall-hangings, wool blankets, ponchos and other items woven with synthetic wool and cotton.  With time, dedication and hard work, she managed to open up a stall in a handicrafts market in a location that is next to the city in her district, which is a place where tourists arrive in the area.  But as she is an enterprising woman, she also has a car that she uses to provide public transportation services on the Tarma-to-Lima route.  

At this time, Nely is planning to travel to various markets in the country to expand her business.  She is currently knitting scarves and hats for the winter, and to do this she needs your help so that she can acquire the items she needs to continue with her business.

This is her 3rd loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to help her continue forward.  She will invest the 2,000 Peruvian soles that she is requesting in the purchase of handicrafts to stock her shop and to buy more colored wool so that she can make her textile products.

loans.use: to buy wool and handicrafts

loans.name: Rutilio Antonio

texts.es: Rutilio de 34 años de edad se dedica a realizar viajes por las diferentes colonias y mercados de su lugar de residencia en su pick up  desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela por la amabilidad y la responsabilidad a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gasto que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, Rutilio está solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos, batería y llantas para su vehículo ya que con lo que ganan no le alcanza para poder realizarlo y esa es su única fuente de trabajo  y poder  llevar el sustento diario  a su hogar y darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rutilio is 34 years old. For several years, he has earned his living traveling between the different settlements and markets of his area in his pick-up. 

He has many customers, due to his friendliness and responsible driving. With what he earns from his work, he is able to afford household expenses. He lives in his own house with his wife and two children. 

Rutilio is asking for a loan to buy spare parts, batteries and tires for his vehicle, as what he earns isn't enough to be able to buy them. This is his only source of work and livelihood to bring home and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, batteries, and tires.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 30 years old and runs a bookshop business in the town of Kangundo. He also offers photocopy and computer services and has been in the business for 3 years. He is married and has no children.

He plans to use this loan to buy textbooks, printing papers, and binding materials to boost his business. He will use the anticipated profits to open another shop. This is his second loan term, and he paid his previous loan successfully.

In the future, Patrick hopes to grow his business and become a stationary supplier.

loans.use: to buy school textbooks, printing papers, and binding materials for his bookstore.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorrro

texts.es: Mercedes del Socorro de 39 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad y aun bajo su responsabilidad originaria del municipio de Chinandega zona donde predomina el comercio de diferentes tipos como: ropa, zapatos, productos plásticos, verduras entre otros al igual que el turismo, mercedes se se dedica a la venta de cosméticos como: maquillajes, cremas, shampoo, perfumenes entre otros mas, realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante a conocidos y amistades,al contado y al crédito, ella tiene 5 años de tener este negocio, el cual ha sido un medio de subsistencia para su familia, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en productos de cosméticos como: maquillajes, cremas, jabones, tintes de cabellos, cremas aliazadoras, también en productos de la omnilife su demanda ha crecido y tiene varios pedidos mas asi logra aprovechar las ventas, tambien la empresa donde aquiere los productos son de buena calidad y es algo que los clientes adquieren con facilidad ella solicita crédito para la compra de capital de trabajo el cual utilizara para la compra de más cosméticos y otros productos mas,  que ofrece a la demanda y de esa manera obtener mejores ingresos para su familia. Mercedes agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Mercedes del Socorro is 39 years old, married and with two underage children who are still under her responsibility. She is from Chinandega where the predominant activities are tourism and the trade and commerce of different products such as clothing, shoes, plastic products and vegetables, among others. Mercedes works selling cosmetics such as makeup, creams, shampoo and perfumes. She sells her products on the street to people she knows and to relatives. She takes both cash and credit. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has been able to take care of her family thanks to this job. She needs the loan to purchase cosmetics such as creams, soap, hair dye, straightening creams, as well as other omnilife products. Her products are in great demand and she has many orders. The company where she gets her supplies from sells high-quality products, which is something that sells very well among her clients. Given the high demand, she is requesting the loan to purchase working capital in order to buy more cosmetics and other products and thus generate a higher income for her family. Mercedes is very grateful for the support Kiva investors are giving to people with low economic resources.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as creams, makeup, perfumes and talcum powder, among others

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es: Ana de 52 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de pan dulce y pan francés desde hace varios años, su panadería la tiene ubicada en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por os buenos precios y la higiene con que lo elabora, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos,  doña Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de latas, azúcar, colorantes,  levadura, harina, etc. para seguir elaborando el pan y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 52, has had a business making sweet bread and French bread for a number of years.  Her bakery is located in her home.  She has a lot of customers, due to her low prices and the hygiene with which she prepares her food.  She lives in her own home along with her life partner and their two children.  

Ana is requesting a loan to buy canned goods, sugar, coloring agents, yeast, flour, etc., to continue with her business making bread.  This way, she can obtain more earnings so that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, sugar, coloring agents, yeast, flour, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena. She previously received a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs of her internet cafe. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures. She also has an electronic reloading business, and she sells ice cream for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rowena dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to be a good businesswoman. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to find strength and encouragement from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo de 21 años de edad, ella se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz y frijol, desde hace 25 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  doña Antonia esta solicitando un crédito par al compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder obtener una mejor cosecha y una mejor ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Antonia, 58, lives in her own home with her husband and their 21-year-old son. She makes a living in agriculture, especially in planting corn and beans. For 25 years, she has sold different products in different markets near her home. With the money she earns, and with her husband's help, they are able to pay their household expenses. Antonia is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, plague controllers, and other supplies. This will bring her a better crop and more income to give her family more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, plague controllers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Motasem

texts.en: Motasem is 22 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa with his family, which consists of 8 members. Ahmad is in his 4th year studying for his Bachelor of Business Administration. He also works in a shoe store. He is planning to get his Bachelor's degree in order to work in his field of study after graduation to start helping his parents financially. However, his parents are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay his upcoming semester's fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay his fees for the next semester.

loans.name: Gulchehramo

texts.ru: Гулчехрамо родилась в 1975 года. Она единственная кормилица своих 4 детей, так как ее муж умер, и она осталась без кормильца. Гулчехрамо после смерти мужа пережила глубокий стресс. Она с 2012 года работает в местной больнице уборщицей. Гулчехрамо и ее дети живут в старом доме, который имеет плохое состояние. Гулчехрамо уже несколько лет мечтает отремонтировать свой старый дом. Она не имеет достаточно денег для покупки строительных материалов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Gulchehramo was born in 1975.  She is the only breadwinner for her four children because her husband died and she was left alone to feed her family.  

After the death of her husband, Gulchehramo went through a lot of stress.  Since 2012, she has been working as a cleaning lady at the local hospital.  

Gulchehramo and her children live in an old house which is in poor condition.  For a few years already, she has been dreaming about repairing her house but she doesn't have enough money to buy building materials.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood and so forth.  She relies on your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as wood and cement to repair her house.

loans.name: Maksuda

texts.ru: Максуда родилась в 1957 года. Она вдова и имеет 2 детей. Максуда имеет трудную судьбу. После смерти мужа ей пришлось пережить много тягости жизни, чтобы обеспечить своих детей Наргизу и Умеда. Она начала свой бизнес скотоводством, так как она живет в сельской местности. Она имела опыта по откармливанию скота, так как она помогала родителям по откармливанию скота. Она является единственным кормильцем в семье. Она уже несколько лет хочет отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2200 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Maksuda was born in 1957. She is a widow and has two children. Her life has been difficult: since her husband's death, she has faced much hardship in trying to provide for her children, Nargiza and Umeda. Maksuda started a business in animal husbandry, as she lives in a rural area. She possesses experience in raising livestock because she helped her parents in this activity; she was the only one in the family who fed the animals. 

For the past few years, Maksuda has wanted to make renovations to her home, but does not have the financial means to do so. She is applying for a loan of 2,200 somoni in order to buy building materials such as cement, wood, and more. She appreciates your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood for repairing the house

loans.name: Holiskhon

texts.ru: Холисхон трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем на доброго человека. Ее муж является мастером по ремонту дома. Холисхон более 10 лет работает в фермерском хозяйстве. До этого она работала разнорабочим в разных местах. Она с детства всегда мечтала иметь свою квартиру и более 10 лет она копит деньги, чтобы купить квартиру. Наконец то она нашла подходящею квартиру, но ей не хватает деньги на сумму 2500 сомони, чтобы купить эту квартиру. С такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она обращается в первые за кредитом. Она честная и порядочная женщина. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Holikhson is a hardworking woman and is married to a kind person. Her husband works as a repairman. Holikhson has worked in agriculture for over 10 years. Prior to this, she worked odd jobs. 

Since childhood, Holikhson has dreamed of owning an apartment and, for over 10 years, has been saving up to buy one. Finally, she has found the perfect apartment, but she needs an extra 2500 somoni to buy it. For this reason, Holikhson is applying for a loan for the first time in her life. She is an honest and decent woman who appreciates your generosity.

loans.use: To buy an apartment.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 25 years old and lives with her spouse and a son in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a services provider for motorcycles; he repairs and troubleshoots the motorbikes. He has been learning these techniques from his childhood, and now he has become very expert and can easily troubleshoot the whole engine. Earlier he was working at a workshop that does not belonging to him, but now he has started this business after getting married so that he could earn the maximum amount. 

He wants to buy some important tools for repairing and spare parts to offer his customers. Therefore, Shamim requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy new repair tools and some spare parts for repairing motorcycles. Shamim says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle parts and tools for her husband's mechanic shop.

loans.name: Arcely

texts.en:
Arcely is requesting a loan to buy various grocery items like noodles, sugar, coffee, canned goods, candies and more. She has been in the retail business for five years and to her observation, she has managed to get an income of 6,000 PHP monthly in the business. Her goal is to keep improving her sales and to be able to sustain the business for her family, especially in order to send her five children to school.

She is now 49 years old and is married to Leo, who is a farmer. They live in the village of Mabini where farming is the major source of income to most of the residents in the village.

loans.use: to buy various grocery items like noodles, sugar, coffee, canned goods, and candies to sell.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 36 years old and is married to her husband Tom. They both support a family of four. Emelda runs a beauty salon and a snacks joint in the town of Ahero. 

This has been her income-generating business for the last eleven years; she gets an average monthly income of 30,000 KES. She has borrowed a fourth loan with Kadet Ltd of 99,000 KES. 

Emelda plans to use this loan of 99,000 KES to purchase cosmetics, hair products, oils, and other items for her salon business. She anticipates getting profits, which she will use to boost her new snack joint. Her dream is to expand her business into a big salon as well as improve on the quality of service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, hair products, and oils for her salon.

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista lives and works outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugarcane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Felista is married and has five children. Both she and her husband are agriculturalists, and they have been farming for 21 years. They have a variety of activities occurring on their homestead, including maize, fruit orchards, livestock, bananas, vegetables, and trees. She wanted to start beekeeping because “one can manage beekeeping together with all other projects in the farm since it is not involving.”

This is Felista’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by beehives to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 30 years old and is married with one child. Her child attends school. She sells clothes, and her concentration is on curtains and sheets. This is the sole source of income for her, and she has had to do it everyday for the last year. She hopes that in the future she will have a stall where she will put up her products and stop moving from one place to another, because it is tiresome. The major challenge in the business is bad debts. 

She found out about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy curtains to sell. The extra income that she will raise will improve her standard of living and educate her child.

loans.use: to buy curtains to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives and works close to Cherengani, in the Kitale region. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Charles is married, and has two children. He is a relatively new farmer, with five years experience, and he is using his land to grow maize, beans, vegetables, and sunflowers. He is excited to start beekeeping because bees and sunflowers go hand in hand: pollination from the bees helps increase sunflower production, while the bees benefit from the nectar and pollen found in the sunflowers themselves. 

This is Charles’ first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated from his hives to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion lives and works close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Simion is single, and has no children. He is a relatively new farmer, having only been farming for two years, and is currently growing maize, beans, avocado, and vegetables. He likes beekeeping because “you can make money without doing much. You just need a good farm.”

This is Simion’s first loan, and he plans to use the income from his hives to start a small business. His hope for the future is “to advance my education to be relevant in today's competitive job market.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa lives and works outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Teresa is married, and has three children. Her husband works as a doctor, while she farms their land. She has been farming for five years, and is currently growing maize, vegetables and bananas. She likes beekeeping because it requires little work and still produces returns. 

This is Teresa’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income from her hives to “add another project like poultry rearing [to] my farm.” Her hope for the future is “to make my farm a model in agribusiness.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy retail products like wheat flour and other flour.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne lives close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Anne is married, and has seven children. Her husband works as a teacher, while she engages in projects on their land. She has been farming for twenty-six years and is currently growing maize, bananas, vegetables, and beans. She likes beekeeping because it is easy to manage and does not require constant supervision. 

This is Anne’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to educate her children. Her hope for the future is to “fend for my family through various projects in my farm and to increase my earning over time.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives in a small town outside of Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Eunice is married and has been farming for more than fifteen years. Both her and her husband are farmers, and they are currently growing maize, vegetables and beans on their land, as well as tending to a tree plantation. These young trees will be very important sources of food for her colonies, as the bees will feed from the trees' nectar and in turn pollinate the young saplings. 

This is Eunice's first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income generated by her hives to invest in her land and save for her old age.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (TubaRaiMetin). She is 28 years old and married and has four children. She runs a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock for her store such as soft drinks, beer, noodles, sugar, coffee, milk, salt, eggs, water, soap, and slippers. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. 

Aurelia is living in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy, including students. She is happy for this loan that is offered to poor people to improve her living condition in the future.

loans.use: Tp buy soft drinks, beer, noodles, sugar, coffee, milk, salt, eggs, water, soap, and slippers to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is able to get an income of PHP 10,000 monthly in mere selling of fish in their village and nearby communities. She has been in the business for nine years already. To further grow the business, she is seeking the lender's financial assistance that will be used as added capital in buying various types of fish that is appropriate to the season, to ensure good sales. 

Rebecca is now 49 years old, married, and has four grown up and school aged children. Farming is the occupation of her husband where income is generated only twice a year.

loans.use: to buy various types of fish appropriate to the season, to ensure good sales.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Joseph is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker, while Joseph works as a mason. He and his wife have been farming for 10 years, and are currently growing maize, tending to an orchard, and raising livestock. 

Joseph has wanted to become a beekeeper for some time, and wanted to thank Kiva lenders, as “they have made my wishes of having beehives in my farm come true.” He is also looking forward to the pollination benefits that the bees will give his crops.

This is Joseph’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his beehives to help educate his children. In the future, Joseph hopes “to have projects in my farm that will supplement my mason job.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert lives and works close to Cherengani, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. At over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” 

Many farmers in the region have started projects planting blue gum trees on their land, which complements the region’s natural forests and provides bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Gilbert is married and has five children. He farms and works as an assistant chief for a nearby constituency, a position in the local government, and his wife is a homemaker. Him and his wife have been farming for more than twenty years, and are currently growing maize, vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and green peppers. 

This is Gilbert’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to invest in his land and pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius lives and works close to Cherengani, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Pius has no children, and has been farming for six years. He is currently farming maize, bananas, vegetables and passion fruit. Pius is a proud member of his local community-based organization, and is thankful that Kiva has been able to offer him and his fellow members loans for beehives. 

This is Pius’ first loan, and he plans to use the income from his beehives to invest in some equipment for his farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah lives near Cherengani, in the Kitale region. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Jonah is married and has five children. He works as an extension officer for the Ministry of Agriculture, while his wife is a homemaker and a farmer. He and his wife have been farming for 25 years, and are currently growing bananas, beans and maize, as well as tending to livestock and dairy animals. 

Jonah is enthusiastic about this project because he knows the benefits that bees can have in terms of crop pollination and forest management. This is his first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income to invest in his farm and pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ogla

texts.en:
Ogla lives and works near Cherengani, in the Kitale region. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugarcane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Ogla is married and has one child. She works as a teacher, while her husband is currently employed as a tour guide. In addition to their primary jobs, both she and her husband have been farming for more than 10 years, and are currently growing maize, beans, bananas, sorghum and vegetables on their land, as well as tending to livestock. 

This is Olga’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income generated by her hives to help pay her child’s school fees as well as for home use.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah lives and works close to Cherengani, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia, one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. 

The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Peninah is married and has six children. Her husband works as an auto mechanic, while she farms their land. She has been farming for twenty years, and is currently growing maize, beans and vegetables, as well as tending to a tree plantation. The young trees in her plantation will be good sources of nectar for her bee colonies, and will help boost her honey production.

This is Peninah’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income generated by her hives to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives and works in Cherengani, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugarcane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Mary has eight children and is a single parent. She has been farming for 15 years, and is currently growing maize and beans on her land, as well as tending to a horticulture plot and a tree plantation. She is excited to become a beekeeper because she loves honey, and wants to participate in its production. 

This is Mary’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her hives to pay for her chlidren’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Rossy

texts.en:
Rossy lives and works near Cherengani, in the Kitale region. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Rossy has three children and is a single parent. She has been farming for 17 years, and is currently growing maize and beans, tending to horticulture crops and fruit orchards, and maintaining tree cover on her land. This natural forest cover will be very beneficial to her beehives, as it will allow her bees almost constant access to the flowers they need to make honey. 

This is Rossy’s first loan on Kiva, and she is excited to become a beekeeper because she sees it as an income-producing project that will not be hard to maintain. Rossy hopes to use the income from her hives to help support her family.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Delmy Del Transito

texts.es: Delmy de 46 años de edad  vive junto a su hija y su nieto en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; Delmy es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor y un gran éxito para el futuro, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa para niños, damas y caballeros. Ella tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Delmy, 46, lives in her own house with her daughter and grandson.  She sells clothes and has been in the business for several years, which has provided her with the necessary experience to make better profits.  She works from home and has created a large customer base as the people know that everything is of good quality, at affordable prices and with an unbeatable service.  Everything is always to the needs and tastes of her customers.  

Delmy is a female entrepreneur who is dedicated to her work and strives hard day after day to make a better living and achieve great success in the future.  In the last few weeks demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of this by making a new investment.  However, she doesn’t have the necessary capital to back her up.  For this reason, she is asking Apoyo Integral for a loan which will allow her to buy clothes for children, women and men.  

She has good references on repayments and a high moral standing.  She assures that she will be able to pay back the loan and at the same time she hopes that it will bring more economic stability to her household.

loans.use: to buy children's, women's and men's clothing

loans.name: Mehrubon

texts.ru: Мехрубон активный и самостоятельный молодой человек в возрасте 23 лет, родился и вырос в районе Хамадони. В данный момент он учится и работает в столице, а его семья находится в районе. Мехрубон еще не женат. Он учится в шестом курсе заочного отделения Государственного Коммерческого Университета Таможенного факультета. Он в будущем хочет стать работником сферы таможни. Сейчас он работает военным. Мехрубону необходимо оплатить за последний год учебы в университете. С такой целью он обратился за кредитом. Он будет сам выплачивать кредит за счет своей работы. Он очень ждет поддержки, так как в следующем году хочет получить диплом о высшем образовании.
texts.en:
Mehrubon is аn energetic, independent young man; he is 23 years old, and was born and raised in the Hamadoni region of Tajikistan.  He is currently studying and working in the capital, whereas his family is elsewhere in the region.  He has yet to be married, and is studying in his 6th year at a university specializing in commerce; he is in a distance-learning program, and hopes to work in the customs service after graduation.  

At the moment, Mehrubon needs to pay the tuition for his final year of study, and is seeking a loan to do so.  He is serving in the army as a soldier, and will be able to pay the loan off with his military pay.  He is urgently awaiting your help, as he is set to graduate next year.

loans.use: pay for his final year of college

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie, age 51, is happy tending her little store. She is married and their family is settled in Caputol, Aloran. The store is her means of earning a living and supporting her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. She keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. She believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Recently, she has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 for the store. She wanted to purchase additional inventory of rice, softdrinks, canned goods, soap and other sellable items. Virgie believes that expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. 

She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there be able to afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase addiitonal inventory of rice, softdrinks, canned goods and soap for her store.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives near Cherengani, in the Kitale region. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak on the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

James is married, and has two children. He works on the family farm, while his wife is employed as a teacher at a local school. James has been farming for eight years, and is currently growing maize, beans, fruits like banana and oranges and is also tending to livestock.
